----

When we started Fortress, we developed a new garment insulation for cold weather clothing. 

For the past four years we have focused on the industrial worker
column2: men and women who have to work in extreme cold weather (down to -40°F). So, our entire focus was on function, keeping people warm and it worked and continues to work very well!

column1: But what about you, those of you who don't live and work in extreme cold conditions? How could you take advantage of this awesome technology without thinking that you had to be in sub-zero conditions to enjoy it?

Well, now you can! We've scaled back our technology (really reigned it in!). We made it thinner, lighter, and more versatile to create an everyday, light-weight, insulated hoodie that will keep you comfortable and warm throughout an incredible temperature range!
Watch the video below as we test the Hybrid Hoodie in the prototype stage in extreme conditions.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/i9A2xpJlrJQ?autohide=1&amp

From the experience of our beta testers and our own experience we found that most people can wear this hoodie comfortably across a nearly 70 degree temperature range. The results were different for each person because not everyone experiences cold in the same way.  And these were the primary factors:
<ul>
• Hydration Level,
• Body Type, and
• Your Activity Level
<div data-id=""13276703""><figure style=""margin: 0px
There are three principles at the forefront of why our system works so well:
<ul>
• Stop the Wind,
• Retain Body Heat,
• Evacuate Moisture (sweat)
<div data-id=""13358620""><figure style=""margin: 0px
1 - Stop the Wind
Wind can be your enemy.  If allowed to, it can suck that warm, yummy heat away from you leaving you shivering and miserable.
The outer fabric we use is tightly woven to be wind resistant, allowing that heat you've spent energy creating to stay with you and keep you warm.
<div data-id=""13346803""><figure style=""margin: 0px
2 - Retain Body Heat
Our proprietary insulation was created to retain its architectural structure (even when wet) maintaining the dead air space that make insulation work. This is our SECRET SAUCE!
<div data-id=""13346819""><figure style=""margin: 0px
3 - Evacuate Moisture (sweat)
We take advantage of the second law of thermodynamics which states:

""When two initially isolated systems in separate but nearby regions of space, each in thermodynamic equilibrium with itself but not necessarily with each other, are then allowed to interact, they will eventually reach a mutual thermodynamic equilibrium. The sum of the entropies of the initially isolated systems is less than or equal to the total entropy of the final combination. Equality occurs just when the two original systems have all their respective intensive variables (temperature, pressure) equal
column2: then the final system also has the same values.""

column1: Simply stated, ""Moisture moves out of the clothing, as long as it's not obstructed"".

Because your body is continually producing heat, there is a constant flow or current from your body to the outside environment (assuming the outside environment is colder and drier).  This flow carries moisture away from your body.
Most other insulation materials used in cold weather clothing collect moisture, reducing the ability of the insulation to do it's job effectively, and is covered by a waterproof layer.
Our insulation, because of its structure, creates a clear path for moisture evacuation without buildup while retaining your body's heat.
By taking advantage of and working with these three critical principles, we are able to do what you see in these videos with nothing more than our own body heat.
<div data-id=""13346827""><figure style=""margin: 0px
GAME CHANGER!!
The purpose of these ice plunges is to demonstrate that our technology can handle even complete saturation (should you actually sweat that much!).
<div data-href=""https://youtu.be/c1GGQ_ijOMk""><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe height=""344"" src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/c1GGQ_ijOMk?feature=oembed&amp
<div data-id=""13255821""><figure style=""margin: 0px
So, why would we do a crowdfunding campaign for this product?

Traditionally, companies invest large amounts of capital ($$) doing research, building inventory, and then marketing the product. We are not traditional, as you can tell from our products. And crowdfunding is still a fairly non-traditional means of producing a product. This campaign is a way for us to target and determine the market demand for colors and sizes with our new model.

You tell us what that demand is by selecting a pledge, answering the after campaign survey, and spreading the word through your circles of influence so they can help us, too!  In return we offer this amazing product to you at a great price.
<div data-id=""13343608""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""13355615""><figure style=""margin: 0px
<div data-id=""13255957""><figure style=""margin: 0px

Production and Fulfillment are ongoing.  Because we started out in KickStarter, we have an obligation to deliver to them first, then Hoodies ordered here on IGG will begin shipping.  Our current timeline is, KS Backers ship December - January, IGG Backers ship January - February.  We will keep everyone updated about any deviation from this timeline.
<div data-id=""13255969""><figure style=""margin: 0px

We were established as a business, in November of 2011 with a focus on industrial workers (Mining, Oil/Gas, Logging, Construction, etc.) in cold weather environments.  We continue to sell the Fortress mid-layer garments to these markets.
Cast of Characters
Dale Lewis, the Boss, the Head Cheese, the Dude-in-Charge.  A family man with a passion for ranching, he has a compassionate streak that keeps us all humble.
<div data-id=""13345410""><figure style=""margin: 0px
John Arbon, Director of Warmth, the guy with the most experience with this technology, and usually the guinea pig for new products (yes, even THIS one! :))
<div data-id=""13280286""><figure style=""margin: 0px
Michelle Allred, the Executive secretary, and CSO (Corporate Shipping Officer) that keeps our office humming and keeps us all on top of our ""to-do"" lists.
<div data-id=""13345436""><figure style=""margin: 0px
Michael Lewis, our Market Ambassador whose insight into the outdoor space in his age group has been invaluable.  And yes, ladies, he's still single!
<div data-id=""13345481""><figure style=""margin: 0px
Linda Lu, Our head seamstress who has spent countless hours building and adjusting prototypes and manages the in-house production.  We owe so much to her and LOVE her cookies!
<div data-id=""13280306""><figure style=""margin: 0px

Let’s face it, the traditional leather wallet is boring.  The drab black, thick and heavy leather with pockets and sleeves hasn’t really changed in ages.

So, we thought, what if we could change how people experienced their wallets. What if the wallet was like a chameleon and could change its skin to fit the user’s moods and emotions? What if the wallet could offer more in terms of protection and prevent your cards from bent and chipped edges? What if all these cool features could be packed neatly into a light, slim and yet futuristic and functional form?

After a year of designing and re-designing our wallet, we’ve finally managed to put all the best features together. Introducing WLLT, the world’s first customizable minimalist wallet. 

 

WLLT is the world’s first customizable minimalist wallet designed to be practical and sleek. Supple imported leather is wrapped around The Core (a precision-machined and laser-cut aluminium card) to make WLLT an innovative fashion statement.
column3:
>

The convergence of leather and metal, WLLT is designed around the innovative Core which allows the skin to be customized making WLLT the fashion accessory of 2018 and the conversation piece at any social gathering.

 

The centre of attention

Although WLLT maintains a slim and minimalist profile, it is enviously purposeful and fashionable. It is precision-made from laser-cut 1.5 mm thick anodized aluminum. The process also involves sand-blasting to increase the hardness of the aluminum. Finally, it is stress-tested for durability. The final version of The Core will be formed from a single piece of aluminum featuring a pressed and molded money clip.

 

RFID Blocking feature

The Core which is made from a single laser-cut piece of aluminum offers a natural layer of protection against RFID intrusion. This extra layer of protection is especially important today where credit card readers and other RFID devices can easily pick up the data stored on your credit cards through only a light swipe or tap on your card, often without you being aware of it. 

We have tested the RFID Blocking worthiness of WLLT successfully as you can see in the accompanying video.
column5:
showinfo=0"">
 
 

Carry your cash, cards and coins without the bulk. WLLT was meticulously designed to pack more content without the bulk and weight of traditional wallets so you can easily slip it into your front or back pockets. It's so slim and light, you might even forget it's there.
column6: >Slim and light enough to fit most pockets.
column9: >Time to get your wallet on a diet?
column12:
>No more bulges (in the wrong places).

 

Quick access to cash, cards and coins

WLLT makes no compromise with what you need to carry . Unlike many minimalist wallets that have a problem accommodating cash, cards and coins at the same time, we’ve spent a year designing and redesigning WLLT to make it work…just perfectly. 

 

The slim wallet that loves flat bills/notes

One of the reasons we created WLLT was because we had to fold our notes many times over for it to fit into our minimalist wallet. Fact is, our wallet was actually more like a card holder. Except for cards, nothing else would fit properly. And every time we wanted to use our notes to pay at one of those auto-pay machine, our bills would get rejected. WLLT solves this problem with the integrated Core which acts as a money clip, all the while keeping a slim minimalist form factor.
column16: >Problem: Solved. No more unsightly crumpled bills which you would expect from other minimalist wallets.
column17:
> 

Innovative design with added security
column18: >Coins stay in, even with a lot of shake, rattle and roll. Thanks to our simple design innovation.
column20:
>

Now you can choose from a variety of materials and designs to suit your changing moods. From colourful leather to blue denim, from canvas to camo prints, make WLLT the ultimate reflection of you. You can even get us to make you your own personalized one and only skin to go with a specially engraved Core in a variety of colours. If you can dream it, chances are we can make it happen. But for our Indiegogo campaign, let's start with these 2 colours.
column25:
> 

Show off your personality and fashion sense with a customizable minimalist wallet that checks all the right boxes. Once we get our campaign funded, we will start a platform to work with designers and artists to create a range of WLLT covers. Hit us up for a chat if you’re a designer/artist who would like to use WLLT as your canvas.
column27: >Switch it up. In a blink of an eye.

column33:
'>CREATIVE TEAM

We’re a bunch of advertising agency folk who have spent the last twenty years branding, positioning and marketing our clients’ services and products. We’ve always loved the challenges and have always tried to stand by the values of creativity and innovation to change human experiences. One of our ambitions was to create our own brand - one which we could hold dear, care for and nurture over time. After over a year of research, brainstorming and prototypes, we’re pleased to announce the birth of WLLT. 

 

 

BE PART OF OUR STORY

Calling all creatives, artists and designers!!! Let's collaborate and make something wonderful. Get in touch with us to find out how you can be a part of WLLT and even get paid for your contributions. 

Follow our journey:

 

CONTACT US

If you have any queries, please don't hesitate to reach us at urwllt@gmail.com

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES 

We have spent the better part of a year researching the various materials needed to turn WLLT into a reality. We've also spent a lot of time working with our manufacturing partners to make sure the desired results are achievable. We've taken every possible measure to ensure that we are able to deliver a high quality product at a great price point. 

As experienced communicators, clear, concise communication is of the utmost importance to us. That said, we'll try our best to address every concern, you, our dear backer may have. Should any issue arise during the production process, we assure you that we will do our best to solve those issues in a timely manner. We do not take lightly the trust you have bestowed us by becoming a WLLT backer. As such, we will keep you informed throughout the whole process, right up to delivery. 

As of now, we believe that we have crossed our t's and dotted our i's. Our manufacturing partners assure us that they are well prepared to handle our orders so we do not foresee any major issue forthcoming. Thank you for your trust and faith in us and we look forward to your support in our campaign.

 

SHIPPING 

It's our first campaign ever so we must get things right. No point creating a fantastic product only to have it get lost in the mail. To ensure every WLLT reaches its rightful owner, we've decided to go with an internationally-recognized logistics provider - DHL, so you can rest assured in a truly trusted and reputable name.

*FOC shipping for Malaysian addresses
We will be absorbing the shipping and logistics charges for WLLT sent to Malaysian addresses. WLLT will be sent using either a local logistics company or Pos Laju.

*Please keep in mind that import fees or any other carrier fees are not included. Depending on your country's custom's regulations, you will have to pay for them upon arrival.

 

FAQ 

• What colours are available?

Currently, WLLT is available in Black (Urban Mantra) and Dark Brown (City Ballistic). When we go full retail, we plan to make WLLT available in more colours and fabric options. 

 

• Where is WLLT manufactured?

WLLT is designed and manufactured entirely in Penang, Malaysia with quality components sourced locally and internationally. 

 

• Does WLLT fit all kinds of bills?

WLLT will fit notes up to 7 cm tall and 18 cm wide. 

 

• How many cards can fit in WLLT?

Because of the elastic band that wraps around WLLT, we find that up to 8 cards fit snugly. Again, because of the elastic properties of the band, users could always squeeze more cards in. 

 

• What is the colour accuracy of the leather? 

Our leather supplier assures us that they will try to ensure the colour accuracy of all their products. However, they have told us that it is impossible to make sure that every order of leather will be 100% the same. Except for black, all other colours may have a small percentage of colour variance. 

 

• How much is the expected retail price of WLLT?

Currently, we expect to market WLLT exclusively through our online store at USD 80 per unit. 

 

• Can I choose multiple delivery addresses if I am buying more than one?

Yes, we are able to accept multiple mailing addresses for backers who pledge more than one unit. However, do note that the delivery/logistic charges will be according to the delivery/shipping address. For instance, if a backer orders two WLLT with shipping addresses in the United States and Singapore, then the shipping charges will correspond with the shipping to both the United States and Singapore. 

 

• How does the RFID work?

By nature, The Core which is made of aluminum is RFID resistant. This quality of aluminum helps prevent unwanted security breaches where RFID scanners are used for malicious intent.  

 

• Do you provide any warranty for WLLT? 

We do not provide any warranty for WLLT. However, every piece will go through stringent quality control before they are shipped to our backers. 

 

• Is cash on delivery (COD) available?

Cash on delivery is not available. As this is an Indiegogo campaign, we are obliged to follow all Indiegogo requirements and regulations throughout the campaign. This includes payment modes and methods.

 

Your kind support of our vision is very much appreciated. It is people like yourself who has given creators a chance to share our ideas with the world. Thank you for your trust and may God bless you always.  

","Let’s face it, the traditional leather wallet is boring.  The drab black, thick and heavy leather with pockets and sleeves hasn’t really changed in ages.So, we thought, what if we could change how people experienced their wallets. What if the wallet was like a chameleon and could change its skin to fit the user’s moods and emotions? What if the wallet could offer more in terms of protection and prevent your cards from bent and chipped edges? What if all these cool features could be packed neatly into a light, slim and yet futuristic and functional form?After a year of designing and re-designing our wallet, we’ve finally managed to put all the best features together. Introducing WLLT, the world’s first customizable minimalist wallet.  WLLT is the world’s first customizable minimalist wallet designed to be practical and sleek. Supple imported leather is wrapped around The Core (a precision-machined and laser-cut aluminium card) to make WLLT an innovative fashion statement.   The convergence of leather and metal, WLLT is designed around the innovative Core which allows the skin to be customized making WLLT the fashion accessory of 2018 and the conversation piece at any social gathering. The centre of attentionAlthough WLLT maintains a slim and minimalist profile, it is enviously purposeful and fashionable. It is precision-made from laser-cut 1.5 mm thick anodized aluminum. The process also involves sand-blasting to increase the hardness of the aluminum. Finally, it is stress-tested for durability. The final version of The Core will be formed from a single piece of aluminum featuring a pressed and molded money clip. RFID Blocking featureThe Core which is made from a single laser-cut piece of aluminum offers a natural layer of protection against RFID intrusion. This extra layer of protection is especially important today where credit card readers and other RFID devices can easily pick up the data stored on your credit cards through only a light swipe or tap on your card, often without you being aware of it. We have tested the RFID Blocking worthiness of WLLT successfully as you can see in the accompanying video.   Carry your cash, cards and coins without the bulk. WLLT was meticulously designed to pack more content without the bulk and weight of traditional wallets so you can easily slip it into your front or back pockets. It's so slim and light, you might even forget it's there.   Slim and light enough to fit most pockets. Time to get your wallet on a diet? No more bulges (in the wrong places). Quick access to cash, cards and coinsWLLT makes no compromise with what you need to carry . Unlike many minimalist wallets that have a problem accommodating cash, cards and coins at the same time, we’ve spent a year designing and redesigning WLLT to make it work…just perfectly.  The slim wallet that loves flat bills/notesOne of the reasons we created WLLT was because we had to fold our notes many times over for it to fit into our minimalist wallet. Fact is, our wallet was actually more like a card holder. Except for cards, nothing else would fit properly. And every time we wanted to use our notes to pay at one of those auto-pay machine, our bills would get rejected. WLLT solves this problem with the integrated Core which acts as a money clip, all the while keeping a slim minimalist form factor.Be organized. In style.  Problem: Solved. No more unsightly crumpled bills which you would expect from other minimalist wallets. Innovative design with added security Coins stay in, even with a lot of shake, rattle and roll. Thanks to our simple design innovation.  Now you can choose from a variety of materials and designs to suit your changing moods. From colourful leather to blue denim, from canvas to camo prints, make WLLT the ultimate reflection of you. You can even get us to make you your own personalized one and only skin to go with a specially engraved Core in a variety of colours. If you can dream it, chances are we can make it happen. But for our Indiegogo campaign, let's start with these 2 colours.Urban Mantra - Black City Ballistic - Dark Brown Show off your personality and fashion sense with a customizable minimalist wallet that checks all the right boxes. Once we get our campaign funded, we will start a platform to work with designers and artists to create a range of WLLT covers. Hit us up for a chat if you’re a designer/artist who would like to use WLLT as your canvas. Switch it up. In a blink of an eye.    CREATIVE TEAMWe’re a bunch of advertising agency folk who have spent the last twenty years branding, positioning and marketing our clients’ services and products. We’ve always loved the challenges and have always tried to stand by the values of creativity and innovation to change human experiences. One of our ambitions was to create our own brand - one which we could hold dear, care for and nurture over time. After over a year of research, brainstorming and prototypes, we’re pleased to announce the birth of WLLT.   BE PART OF OUR STORYCalling all creatives, artists and designers!!! Let's collaborate and make something wonderful. Get in touch with us to find out how you can be a part of WLLT and even get paid for your contributions. Follow our journey: CONTACT USIf you have any queries, please don't hesitate to reach us at urwllt@gmail.com RISKS AND CHALLENGES We have spent the better part of a year researching the various materials needed to turn WLLT into a reality. We've also spent a lot of time working with our manufacturing partners to make sure the desired results are achievable. We've taken every possible measure to ensure that we are able to deliver a high quality product at a great price point. As experienced communicators, clear, concise communication is of the utmost importance to us. That said, we'll try our best to address every concern, you, our dear backer may have. Should any issue arise during the production process, we assure you that we will do our best to solve those issues in a timely manner. We do not take lightly the trust you have bestowed us by becoming a WLLT backer. As such, we will keep you informed throughout the whole process, right up to delivery. As of now, we believe that we have crossed our t's and dotted our i's. Our manufacturing partners assure us that they are well prepared to handle our orders so we do not foresee any major issue forthcoming. Thank you for your trust and faith in us and we look forward to your support in our campaign. SHIPPING It's our first campaign ever so we must get things right. No point creating a fantastic product only to have it get lost in the mail. To ensure every WLLT reaches its rightful owner, we've decided to go with an internationally-recognized logistics provider - DHL, so you can rest assured in a truly trusted and reputable name.*FOC shipping for Malaysian addressesWe will be absorbing the shipping and logistics charges for WLLT sent to Malaysian addresses. WLLT will be sent using either a local logistics company or Pos Laju.*Please keep in mind that import fees or any other carrier fees are not included. Depending on your country's custom's regulations, you will have to pay for them upon arrival. FAQ • What colours are available?Currently, WLLT is available in Black (Urban Mantra) and Dark Brown (City Ballistic). When we go full retail, we plan to make WLLT available in more colours and fabric options.  • Where is WLLT manufactured?WLLT is designed and manufactured entirely in Penang, Malaysia with quality components sourced locally and internationally.  • Does WLLT fit all kinds of bills?WLLT will fit notes up to 7 cm tall and 18 cm wide.  • How many cards can fit in WLLT?Because of the elastic band that wraps around WLLT, we find that up to 8 cards fit snugly. Again, because of the elastic properties of the band, users could always squeeze more cards in.  • What is the colour accuracy of the leather? Our leather supplier assures us that they will try to ensure the colour accuracy of all their products. However, they have told us that it is impossible to make sure that every order of leather will be 100% the same. Except for black, all other colours may have a small percentage of colour variance.  • How much is the expected retail price of WLLT?Currently, we expect to market WLLT exclusively through our online store at USD 80 per unit.  • Can I choose multiple delivery addresses if I am buying more than one?Yes, we are able to accept multiple mailing addresses for backers who pledge more than one unit. However, do note that the delivery/logistic charges will be according to the delivery/shipping address. For instance, if a backer orders two WLLT with shipping addresses in the United States and Singapore, then the shipping charges will correspond with the shipping to both the United States and Singapore.  • How does the RFID work?By nature, The Core which is made of aluminum is RFID resistant. This quality of aluminum helps prevent unwanted security breaches where RFID scanners are used for malicious intent.   • Do you provide any warranty for WLLT? We do not provide any warranty for WLLT. However, every piece will go through stringent quality control before they are shipped to our backers.  • Is cash on delivery (COD) available?Cash on delivery is not available. As this is an Indiegogo campaign, we are obliged to follow all Indiegogo requirements and regulations throughout the campaign. This includes payment modes and methods. Your kind support of our vision is very much appreciated. It is people like yourself who has given creators a chance to share our ideas with the world. Thank you for your trust and may God bless you always.",41.0,1,"1 Campaign

Gizmag – “Lightweight multi-spanner will fix your bike, open your beer.”
column3: utm_campaign=facebook"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">Everyday Carry – “
column4: >In the same way that their Tool Pens cycle through bits, Mininch’s WRENCHit cycles through interchangeable wrenches.
column6: >Core77 – “Mininch wants to tidy up the bulky tools in your life. To do it they've made the WRENCHit: a bucket worth of wrenches crammed into a super slim multi-tool. ”
column7:
> 

HiConsumption – “Wrenchit a powerful and hefty tool without all the unnecessary bulk of a toolbox. They fit in your pocket, desk drawer, or pencil holder with ease.”
column8:
>

 

We are team “mininch” (pronounced by “mini-inch”), our mission is to create innovative and good designs for enabling people a better life, also offer the best user experiences through our thoughtfully composed products and top-level services. We have developed and launched two elegant yet powerful multi-tools: Tool Pen and Tool Pen mini. 

    “You guys are awesome. Very happy with your attention to detail and the fact you shipped your product on time. I think Kickstarter should use your company as the reference for how a project should be executed. No joke.” - Brian Phillips

    “Very surprised, wonderfully packaged, excellent piece of equipment, easy to use, good to look at."" - Phoenix Youth

    “The machining, everything - it's so beautiful and classy. Love, love, love this set. So useful, so well machined, so precise. I love the way the cap goes on - all of it. Superb job, guys. My hat is off to you.” - Shelley Gammon

    “Today I experienced the unexpected and I am glad that mininch was in my bag (^_^) “ – Ibnu Salim

column1: <figure style=""margin: 0px

WRENCHit is a portable and multi-functional spanner, but the one that's totally different from every other project you’d ever seen before. Inherit the joyful experience of using Tool Pens, WRENCHit employs similar “Pop-A-Point” design that lets you select and interchange the wrenches with different sizes and shapes while cycling through. With a tough yet pocket-friendly wrench channel (sleeve), it allows you to slide the wrenches in and out very smoothly, and the sleeve will also offer a sturdy arm for applying torque to turn objects.

This one-stop toolbox will eliminate many spanners or toolkits you need to carry, thereby you’ll enjoy the handy and deft construction, as well as its convenience and flexibility.
column2:
>

 

Each WRENCHit carries up to 5 wrenches, and there are 15+ most-frequently-used functions we create initially. The sleeve is made of high-grade ""SUS 420 Stainless Steel"" with a sandblasted finish, and every wrench is also using SUS 420, which makes this powerful tool strong and durable with the well-balanced heft and strength. Aside from that, the size and spec appear to be engraved on every wrench legibly, you’ll effortlessly find which one you need and where it’s positioned in the sleeve.

column1: <figure style=""margin: 0px

Aesthetically, WRENCHit stays neat and simple designs. You’ll appreciate its lightweight but catch-all implement, so that you can casually carry it with you on the go. Swapping of wrenches will let you do everything of turning various nuts or bolts from your furniture, bike, appliances, to many sport equipment and household gadgets.
column2:
>
 

WRENCHit is more than just a novel toolset, it’s an innovative and clever solution that makes repairs a cinch. We believe this thoughtful and unprecedented design will bring you the best experiences, like what you met in Tool Pen’s journey!

column1: <div data-id=""5489024""><figure style=""margin: 0px
For WRENCHit project, we'll still collaborate with existing supply chain partners who had developed and manufactured our high-quality Tool Pens. All products are made in Taiwan &
column2: shipped from Taiwan, and we aim to deliver your rewards on September, 2016.

WRENCHit is a portable and multi-functional spanner, but the one that's totally different from every other project you’d ever seen before. Inherit the joyful experience of using Tool Pens, WRENCHit employs similar “Pop-A-Point” design that lets you select and interchange the wrenches with different sizes and shapes while cycling through. With a tough yet pocket-friendly wrench channel (sleeve), it allows you to slide the wrenches in and out very smoothly, and the sleeve will also offer a sturdy arm for applying torque to turn objects.This one-stop toolbox will eliminate many spanners or toolkits you need to carry, thereby you’ll enjoy the handy and deft construction, as well as its convenience and flexibility. Each WRENCHit carries up to 5 wrenches, and there are 15+ most-frequently-used functions we create initially. The sleeve is made of high-grade ""SUS 420 Stainless Steel"" with a sandblasted finish, and every wrench is also using SUS 420, which makes this powerful tool strong and durable with the well-balanced heft and strength. Aside from that, the size and spec appear to be engraved on every wrench legibly, you’ll effortlessly find which one you need and where it’s positioned in the sleeve.
Swap Wrenches Very Simply

Aesthetically, WRENCHit stays neat and simple designs. You’ll appreciate its lightweight but catch-all implement, so that you can casually carry it with you on the go. Swapping of wrenches will let you do everything of turning various nuts or bolts from your furniture, bike, appliances, to many sport equipment and household gadgets. WRENCHit is more than just a novel toolset, it’s an innovative and clever solution that makes repairs a cinch. We believe this thoughtful and unprecedented design will bring you the best experiences, like what you met in Tool Pen’s journey!

For WRENCHit project, we'll still collaborate with existing supply chain partners who had developed and manufactured our high-quality Tool Pens. All products are made in Taiwan & shipped from Taiwan, and we aim to deliver your rewards on September, 2016.

Our Story
I came to Japan in 1988 designing shop interiors for a major
Japanese apparel brand. In '92, I became a freelance creative director
and worked with many clients across the country.
<div>From
2004 I consulted and provided branding knowhow to the owner of a major
Japanese ""fast fashion"" retailers before moving to Kyoto to research the
philosophy of the kimono, and to develop a process of combining
traditional silk kimono fabric with vintage denim.
In
Kyoto I was lucky  enough to team up with a Peter Card, a British jeans
designer with over twenty years  experience in the jeans industry
in Japan and on the international stage. Our joint determination to
launch a mid price, yet high quality brand resulted in Gion Jeans being

launched in 2010.
 
Now in its fifth year, positive feedback has encouraged us to take the brand to the next level and we are ready to open our first shop. We understand donations don't come easy, so for this limited time we will be offering these irresistible incentives.
- Lee Longshaw (Creative Director)
First Shop Campaign
At Gion Jeans we do not sell online despite repeated requests. However, for this
limited period  we are offering our fine jeans to you directly
via INDIEGOGO as we strive to use this campaign to fund our own

first shop.

    What YOU get

    For your generous contribution to our fundraising campaign, we are offering exclusive deals for this limited time only. For this select time only, you will receive:

    • Choice online purchases never before offered
• Our premiere line-up of specially crafted denim jeans for reduced prices
Exclusive membership to our online purchases. This choice service will only be available to backers of this campaign!
Quality Jeans for the Denim Connoisseur
Gion Jeans
are the fruits of the labors of Lee Longshaw as proprietor and creative director and
Peter as chief designer, director and in house denim specialist.
The
combination of the highest quality selvage denim and traditional kimono fabric
that combines the esthetic of inner beauty with durable comfort.
<ul> <li>
For the first time online - our choice GION JEANS. SLIM FIT denim will debut in two unique washes: GION Classic Raw and Gion Dark Vintage.
<li>
Never before seen GION limited polo top - available in three washes!
<li>
Custom donations -  Want to order multiple denim products? Needing class polo tops for the whole golf team? Feel free to send us a request at press@gionjeans.com

For pictures and more information regarding sizes or perks - please click HERE to view our executive campaign page!

Follow us live on Twitter at:
https://twitter.com/GionJeans

Get something wonderful to wear and support a great cause. All backers will also get a bonus gaming bundle (total value: $23.45) for free!

THANK YOU!Thank you to all who supported this campaign! We donated $925 to charity resulting from the Indiegogo campaign + membership purchases at rpgcrossing.com + independent direct donations to our team page at the Brain and Behavior Research Foundation!

Two THREE unique shirts: We are producing three shirts. The first two designs are crosses between the word 'Ork' and something else, which itself is a play on the name of our community (RPG Crossing.) These designs are ""glyphs"" or pictograms. The third design is ""The Spirit of Snowman Vengeance"" which is featured on our postcards.

column3: >Important information about ""Spirit of Snowman Vengeance""
column4: >The beautiful ""Spirit of Snowman Vengeance"" is a late addition and Indiegogo rules would not allow us to update all perks to include it explicitly! If you want this shirt, please select any design option and let us know what you really want via the 'ask a question' link above or by responding to our email after you pledge! Don't worry—we will communicate to verify all preferences including designs and sizes at the end of the campaign, before we print your shirts!

column1: Design #1: Door+Ork (""D+Ork"") final art
Design #2: Ork+Orchestra (""Orkestra"") final art
Design #3: ""The Spirit of Snowman Vengeance"" final art
Shirts will be high quality. We have ordered shirts from this supplier previously. They came out beautiful and have held up perfectly for years.

The art will be wonderful. We are working with a professional artist, illustrator, and animator with over twenty years of post-graduate education and professional experience. I've seen so many great renderings that I'm very excited about the final product.

Pledges support a good cause. The BBR Foundation is a very highly rated charity that supports grants for mental health research. Even if you don't support this campaign, please consider donating to them directly through our team page on their donation site.

RPG Crossing Community Supporter memberships support a welcoming gaming community. All are welcome to come and try out the RPG Crossing play-by-post gaming community for free, but we find it much more welcoming without the ads and the good feeling of having supported a community called the ""best RP experience on the internet."" (source: Web of Trust review) Don't be fooled by the 90s decor (yeah, yeah)—you will not meet a finer group of folks on the internet. And maybe if we get enough support, we can do something about the drapes....

We are trustworthy. RPG Crossing is a welcoming community run by gamers for gamers that has dealt fairly with its community members for over a decade. We aren't going anywhere, and we will deliver. To quote one of our members, ""I have been an active member here since 2004. I've trusted them with my personal information and have had no issues. I have voluntarily given them money so they can continue to exist because the site is that good."" (source: Web of Trust review)
What We're Aiming For
Goal: $1000 — enough that we can get some quantity discounts and break even on the shirts.
We'd love to make a startlingly large donation to the BBR Foundation and introduce some new folks to our community along the way.

Net revenue, if any, on this venture will go to the RPG Crossing Community. The community has aging architecture and is badly in help of more time than its volunteer maintainers can provide. We would dearly love to have a cash reserve to be able to move forward with some critical infrastructure projects and move the site into the 21st century.
What You Get
You have options, but no matter what you choose every pledge will support mental health research.
OPTION 1: Shirts!
<ul>
•  Gildan 100% cotton t-shirts
• These are the same shirts we have used previously, and they have held up perfectly after years of washes
<li>This is the same printer we have used previously, and their work has likewise stood up perfectly for years (Armadillo Printwear)
column2: if we end up with a lot of Canadian orders we may also print shirts in Canada rather than ship them North, but if we do, the quality will not be compromised

column1: • The shirts will have the custom Ork Glyph artwork on the front, and an RPG Crossing logo on the back across the shoulders.
• If you need a shirt size that is not listed as an option, please contact us!
• Delivery is expected to be the end of February.
OPTION 2: Membership to RPG Crossing (part of the Gamer Bundle)
<ul>
• A one-year membership to RPG Crossing  normally costs $25. These are the primary way the site pays its bills.
• The gamer bundle includes a $5 discount on the membership PLUS the RPG Crossing donates $5 to charity (RPG Crossing takes in $15 minus fees instead of the normal $25.)
• Note:  you do not need a membership to participate in the community. Give RPG Crossing a spin for free (forever, if you like)
column2: a good way to start is by making a thread in the new members section

column1: • Delivery is within 3 days of provision of a username on the site.
OPTION 3: Personalized Ork Art
<ul>

• Our artist has shown me so many awesome and hilarious sketches at this point. If you grab this opportunity, you will send Darren a photo of an individual and he will produce an Orkified version! See what he's done to his own children (terrible!):

• Also, because of the good cause and the community, the artist is donating his work, but he will receive half of all proceeds from the personalized Ork art. Support our artist! We want him to want to do this again!
• Delivery is expected before the end of January, but may be much earlier (especially the digital scans.)
OPTION 4: ""The Spirit of Snowman Vengeance"" postcards
• Buy a 20 pack of these to use as playful greeting and thank you cards!
BONUS! GAMING PDF BUNDLE FOR ALL BACKERS!
The fantastic RPG community has gotten behind our project. The total value of this Bundle is $23.45. Every backer will get bonus material worth almost the entire cost of a shirt FOR FREE!
The full list is now:

- Infinite Dungeon: The Halls of the Eternal Moment Level One - The Overgrown by Jeff Lee, Michael McCarthy and Rich Redman with Louis Porter Jr.
- Advancing with Class: The Magus by Knotty-Works
- The Planar Paragon by Knotty-Works
- Hero Kids RPG by Justin Halliday
- Urban Faerie Pocket Edition by Postmortem Studios
Thanks to these publishers for helping us out! All of them have lots of good stuff at DriveThruRPG.
Delivery
We've done this whole international shirt delivery game before, and we are confident that we can do it well again.
Delivery time frames:
<ul>
<li>

Shirts: planned delivery is end of February. The timeline suggests that we'll have shirts in the mail by mid January, but experience has shown that something along the way will take an extra couple of weeks.
<li>
Cards: already printed. Packs of 20 will arrive by mid-January.
<li>
Custom orkified art: estimated delivery will be 6 weeks after receipt of your photo, with a digital scan arriving a head of the physical drawing. This could also be much quicker.
<li>
Community Supporter memberships at RPG Crossing: within 3 days of provision of a user name after backing
Stretch Goals!
If things go well and we have the volume to make it reasonable to do additional styles, then we will! We are planning the following stretch goals:

$2500 - add an option to choose women's cut t-shirts
$5000 - add a new perk at $5 more than t-shirts: long-sleeved shirts
$7500 - new t-shirt colour option: white
$10000 - add a new perk at $20 more than t-shirts: hoodies
$706 raised for charity – +1 month for CS memberships
column2:
>ACHIEVED!!!
$1000 raised for charity – +1 month for CS memberships

column1: Want more shirts?

If you'd like more than one or two shirts, please contact me. We can arrange for additional shirts on top of existing orders.  Email or visit the 'Ask a question' link above (which will also result in email communication.) Extra shirts will be $22 plus postage (which will be a small surplus amount for the extra weight that will vary depending on where you live).
Other Ways You Can Help
Whether you can spare the cash or not, please share this campaign! Get in touch and tell us what you think of it!
Don't forget that you can use the Indiegogo share tools up top!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

My name is Caligo Bastet.
I'm a being of many talents and art is what I breathe.
I'm a YouTuber, Singer-Songwriter, Makeup Artist, Alternative Model and also a self taught Designer.

My goal is to create a dark, unique, over-the-top, completely altered clothing line that will consist of both a ready-made, ""lighter"" alternative clothing, and complex, sinister, one-of-a-kind pieces, like the ones I make for myself:
One-of-a-kind clothing, for one-of-a-kind beings.

All made by myself.
100% Vegan and cruelty free
100% Unisex
100% Unique and shadow bound.
For all sizes, genders and beings.

column3:
'>I've been trying to find clothes for myself for years, only to be disappointed by the price, designs and fit of clothing.

That's when I started DIYing my own clothes.
After years or creations in all fields, I was amazed by the positive feedback from my followers and subscribers.
I never thought I could create to this level and with time I only became better and better.

Seeing that no one seems to make clothing similar to mine, and especially seeing the lack of options for truly unisex clothing, together with bad fits, high prices and a market filled with animal-derived materials - all just made me more motivated and determined to create something of my own.


 I decided to open this campaign to launch the start of my clothing line: NecroHex.

The goal with this campaign is to raise enough money to buy needed materials and equipment to further the line and create amazing new ready-made and one-of-a-kind pieces. I don't have much money to invest myself - which is why I need you to show your support by purchasing a reward and help make NecroHex a reality!

Right now I'm offering limited numbers of my first ready-made design to start all of this off. while also offering prints and general donations.

There is a very limited amount of vests -
Only 9 to start - but if this campaign is a success, you can expect these to launch with my store, as well as new designs, and if all goes well, one of a kind pieces!



I'm also offering prints of my modeling works in high quality A3 paper, anything I can to launch my dream of making this world a more beautiful and dark place.



Keep your eyes peeled! I will also auction one one-of-a-kind piece during this campaign to help me reach my goal and give you guys a sneak peak into what I can achieve!

I HAVE gotten a lot of positive feedback from you, and you guys asked me for this for so long, but I want to see how you really feel about this when it's a reality.
Making this campaign will allow me to fund the vests I made for this, give me a general idea to how much demand there is for this kind of clothing and also allow me to invest the money into new creations and progress.

I have so many plans for this line.
I know how far it can get, and I feel it really is something that no one else is offering,
But I need your support to make this a reality!

Please SHARE this, DONATE if you can, or just BUY one of my creations!
I promise you won't be disappointed, and I can't wait for you to see what I plan to unleash upon this world!

column5: >CAMPAIGN MOVED. VISIT New Site

column6:
>The Opioid Crisis

     Has not peaked, does not discriminate, and has killed more people every year for the past three years than the Vietnam, Iraq, and Afghanistan Wars, combined.  It kills far more people than gun violence, car accidents, suicide, homicide, and terrorism every year.
column7:
>The Children of the Crisis

     We are at risk of losing multiple generations of American children if we do not break this cycle, now.  The children of this crisis are the ones that have witnessed their parents and family members overdose, become incarcerated, and die in front of them.  They're the ones on the other end of the 911 calls.  The ones that have lost everything.  

     The trauma and adverse childhood experiences these children have suffered has lifelong consequences of more tragedy, with many children continuing living the cycle they grew up in by turning to drug abuse themselves.  These children need to heal, need to know they matter, and need to know that they have a future.
column8:
>What do we do?

We start a movement.  The people of America, her citizens, must support these children if we are to break the cycle and give our children a fighting chance.  There has been no solution proposed by the government to help these children, and there is no time to wait.  Just as all other great social movements throughout the history of our country, we start a movement and create the change, ourselves.
column10:
What You Can Do

 

(See the FAQ for more details about these four steps.)
column15: >
column16:
>Lily's Place

We’re honored to announce that we’ve partnered with Lily’s Place—the first center in the nation to provide medical and therapeutic care to infants suffering from Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome (NAS) while offering assistance to families.  Their mission is to treat and care for these newborns that are born drug exposed, while also offering non-judgmental support, education, and counseling services to families and caregivers.

We created this shirt exclusively for Lily’s Place.  All proceeds will be donated to them to support their continued success in accomplishing their mission of caring for these babies. With your purchase of this shirt, you can choose to donate one of 25 limited quantity onesies or donate items such as diapers, wipes, blankets, etc., to their children. 

Lily’s Place is a non-profit organization and relies on your donations to help these babies.  You can make a one-time monetary donation or become a monthly supporter by visiting their website, here: https://www.lilysplace.org
column19:
>Why All the Paper Airplanes?

 

 

     It’s the message of hope you’re sending to the children. Literally as a penpal and with your donated shirts. Figuratively when you’re a stranger that’s telling them that they matter and that they have a future.
column20:
>Sponsorships

     It's best that we talk before you commit to one of our sponsorships.  Please email us and we can start the conversation.  There are great opportunities to have together and we look forward to working with you.
column21:
>Our Manufacturing and Policies

     We are using the highest-quality materials and manufacturers we reasonably can afford.  We have ensured that all working conditions are ethical and safe, fair wages are paid, no harmul chemicals or materials, no sweatshops, and, most importantly, absolutely no child labor. 

   All of our fabric originates in the USA and all of our printing occurs here.  Some of our shirts are being custom made, cut and sewn specially for us, with 100% Made in America certified.  We also use some manufacturers that ship to Central America for assembly before returning the product to the USA, and we have thoroughly researched their processes.  We are only using those that are WRAP Certified: http://www.wrapcompliance.org/
column22:
>Special Thanks

    *Mikee ""Streets"" Smith from No Love Lost Films- for filming our breathtaking crowdfunding video.  What was planned as one day of shooting in Huntington and then going to the park with a group of kids turned into 4 days of filming and weeks of editing, countless hours of production, and way too many lost hours of work and sleep to get the video just perfect.  No one would have been able to capture this message and tell the story like Mike, and we're extremely grateful for his patience. 

Although he did a brilliant job on our crowdfunding video, he specializes in weddings and has captured some incredible one's, so far, and is highly recommeneded.  Check out his company, No Love Lost Films, here:  https://www.facebook.com/nolovelostfilms/ 

    *Daniel Ray from Buffalo Atlas - for designing the Lily's Place T-shirt.  Visit Buffalo Atlas here for graphic design work from an amazing artist and person: https://www.facebook.com/Buffaloatlas/

    *Moriah Lockhart for designing the storycards.  We're blown away by Moriah's hand-drawn renditions of the ""world-shakers"" that will be sent to the children on their postcards and are certain the .  Moriah will be continuing this series as she is passionate about the meaning behind this series and is excited to give back to the children and community with her artwork. View her portfolio here: https://www.behance.net/moriahjloc440c

    *Sarah Tayy for the awesome 3D Glasses Photoshoot.  Sarah not only is a great artist and model but also has a huge heart for being a part of this movement with us.  She's available for booking by visiting her modeling page, here: https://www.facebook.com/Sarah.Tay4/

     You can also catch her streaming live on Twitch at: https://twitch.tv/sarahtayy

    *Our Ambassadors - we've gathered up a lively team of ambassadors that are ready to spread the movement nationwide and get help to the children in all of their home states.  We only accept those that are passionate about the cause and are so very thankful that we have connected with so many great people.  If you're interested in joining our ambassador program, fill out the form, here:  http://ftrnow.com/ambassadors

    *The countless others - we've spoken to hundreds and hundreds and people since 2017, (and are still trying to catch up with emails and messages!), that have been absolutely crucial and vitally important to this mission.   We keep repeating this phrase, but it could never be more true:  ""We are not 'We' without you.""  Thank you!
column23:
>Contact Us

Email us: info@ftrnow.com

Message us on FB: https://www.facebook.com/ftrnow
column24:
>Frequently Asked Questions

 

Where do I choose my Size, Color, and Design?

 

 

Fulfillment Time

     We're aiming for the end of August 2018 to fulfill all of the orders.  We will be posting updates and a timeline, very soon.  

  Remember, when you place your order, you will receive an email that asks for your choices of size, color, and design.  This email will not come automatically after your purchase, although you will receive confirmation from IndieGoGo.  

 

1) Buy One, Give One

     We understand that simply giving a shirt to a child is not enough.  You can be certain they'll be thrilled to receive cool, free clothes, but we know that we need to do more, which is where the other three steps come into play. 

2) Send Them Hope

     The shirts sent to the children are designed to inspire and let know that they have a future.  We give away the same shirts to children that we sell to children, but we include extras, such as stickers, motivational messages, and our world-shaker storycards.  These are postcards that tell the story of a person that has grown up and changed the world, despite their turbulent, abusive, and often drug-ridden childhood beginnings. 

3) Donations of Proceeds

     We are connecting with youth organizations that are working with these youth in all 50 states, and will send the donations to one of our partner organizations in your state.  This way, you know that your contributions are making an impact close to home.  Unfortunately, there is no nationwide, overarching organization for children of drug crises, (although, this is our long-term goal).  Therefore, we identify as many organizations as possible that are working with the children, although it is not their main daily operation. 

     The portions of proceeds donated vary, by organizational partner, so we don't give an example ""10% of proceeds"" quote like most.  We want to give more than just money, but still strive to maximize our donations.  After providing the free shirts, extras, paying for the organizations to distribute the shirts, and the costs of the penpal program, we still try to provide as much as we possibly can.  Like any other business, we have overhead and operational costs, but we absorb as much as these costs as possible in order to donate as much as possible.  The more we mature and gain momentum, the more children we'll be able to reach.

If you would like to partner with us, please fill out this form on our website: http://ftrnow.com/partner-with-us/

4) Penpalships

     The most exciting part of what we're offering, in our opinion.  This is the connection that we all yearn for as humans, and how one can tell that they're making a true difference in one's life.  We can't tell you which side of the message that difference will be made: yours or theirs.  We identify children and work with our partners to find children that would benefit from and enjoy this program.  We also enroll the children in our electronic newsletter via email, so we assist in creating them email addresses and help teach them the technological skills necessary to access it, if needed. 

     All communication goes through us.  We will not be connecting you directly with the child, due to obvious privacy concerns for both parties.  We will monitor and screen all communications and set strict guidelines for this program.  Communication will be through postal mail, email, or our online messaging system.  We plan to partner with independent third-parties that will assist in regulating this program.  We are taking funds from this campaign and using them to cover the legal costs associated with ensuring this program is strict, legal, follows all HIPAA guidelines, and protects the safety and privacy of everyone involved.  This program will not be active until all legal work is completed.

","CAMPAIGN MOVED. VISIT New Site

column1: future-clothing.com  The Opioid Crisis     Has not peaked, does not discriminate, and has killed more people every year for the past three years than the Vietnam, Iraq, and Afghanistan Wars, combined.  It kills far more people than gun violence, car accidents, suicide, homicide, and terrorism every year. The Children of the Crisis     We are at risk of losing multiple generations of American children if we do not break this cycle, now.  The children of this crisis are the ones that have witnessed their parents and family members overdose, become incarcerated, and die in front of them.  They're the ones on the other end of the 911 calls.  The ones that have lost everything.       The trauma and adverse childhood experiences these children have suffered has lifelong consequences of more tragedy, with many children continuing living the cycle they grew up in by turning to drug abuse themselves.  These children need to heal, need to know they matter, and need to know that they have a future. What do we do?We start a movement.  The people of America, her citizens, must support these children if we are to break the cycle and give our children a fighting chance.  There has been no solution proposed by the government to help these children, and there is no time to wait.  Just as all other great social movements throughout the history of our country, we start a movement and create the change, ourselves.  What We Do & What You Can Do (See the FAQ for more details about these four steps.)  Choose Your Shirt Designs!         Lily's PlaceWe’re honored to announce that we’ve partnered with Lily’s Place—the first center in the nation to provide medical and therapeutic care to infants suffering from Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome (NAS) while offering assistance to families.  Their mission is to treat and care for these newborns that are born drug exposed, while also offering non-judgmental support, education, and counseling services to families and caregivers.We created this shirt exclusively for Lily’s Place.  All proceeds will be donated to them to support their continued success in accomplishing their mission of caring for these babies. With your purchase of this shirt, you can choose to donate one of 25 limited quantity onesies or donate items such as diapers, wipes, blankets, etc., to their children. Lily’s Place is a non-profit organization and relies on your donations to help these babies.  You can make a one-time monetary donation or become a monthly supporter by visiting their website, here: https://www.lilysplace.org Why All the Paper Airplanes?       It’s the message of hope you’re sending to the children. Literally as a penpal and with your donated shirts. Figuratively when you’re a stranger that’s telling them that they matter and that they have a future. Sponsorships     It's best that we talk before you commit to one of our sponsorships.  Please email us and we can start the conversation.  There are great opportunities to have together and we look forward to working with you.  Our Manufacturing and Policies     We are using the highest-quality materials and manufacturers we reasonably can afford.  We have ensured that all working conditions are ethical and safe, fair wages are paid, no harmul chemicals or materials, no sweatshops, and, most importantly, absolutely no child labor.    All of our fabric originates in the USA and all of our printing occurs here.  Some of our shirts are being custom made, cut and sewn specially for us, with 100% Made in America certified.  We also use some manufacturers that ship to Central America for assembly before returning the product to the USA, and we have thoroughly researched their processes.  We are only using those that are WRAP Certified: http://www.wrapcompliance.org/  Special Thanks    *Mikee ""Streets"" Smith from No Love Lost Films- for filming our breathtaking crowdfunding video.  What was planned as one day of shooting in Huntington and then going to the park with a group of kids turned into 4 days of filming and weeks of editing, countless hours of production, and way too many lost hours of work and sleep to get the video just perfect.  No one would have been able to capture this message and tell the story like Mike, and we're extremely grateful for his patience. Although he did a brilliant job on our crowdfunding video, he specializes in weddings and has captured some incredible one's, so far, and is highly recommeneded.  Check out his company, No Love Lost Films, here:  https://www.facebook.com/nolovelostfilms/     *Daniel Ray from Buffalo Atlas - for designing the Lily's Place T-shirt.  Visit Buffalo Atlas here for graphic design work from an amazing artist and person: https://www.facebook.com/Buffaloatlas/    *Moriah Lockhart for designing the storycards.  We're blown away by Moriah's hand-drawn renditions of the ""world-shakers"" that will be sent to the children on their postcards and are certain the .  Moriah will be continuing this series as she is passionate about the meaning behind this series and is excited to give back to the children and community with her artwork. View her portfolio here: https://www.behance.net/moriahjloc440c    *Sarah Tayy for the awesome 3D Glasses Photoshoot.  Sarah not only is a great artist and model but also has a huge heart for being a part of this movement with us.  She's available for booking by visiting her modeling page, here: https://www.facebook.com/Sarah.Tay4/      You can also catch her streaming live on Twitch at: https://twitch.tv/sarahtayy    *Our Ambassadors - we've gathered up a lively team of ambassadors that are ready to spread the movement nationwide and get help to the children in all of their home states.  We only accept those that are passionate about the cause and are so very thankful that we have connected with so many great people.  If you're interested in joining our ambassador program, fill out the form, here:  http://ftrnow.com/ambassadors    *The countless others - we've spoken to hundreds and hundreds and people since 2017, (and are still trying to catch up with emails and messages!), that have been absolutely crucial and vitally important to this mission.   We keep repeating this phrase, but it could never be more true:  ""We are not 'We' without you.""  Thank you! Contact UsEmail us: info@ftrnow.comMessage us on FB: https://www.facebook.com/ftrnow  Frequently Asked Questions Where do I choose my Size, Color, and Design?  Fulfillment Time     We're aiming for the end of August 2018 to fulfill all of the orders.  We will be posting updates and a timeline, very soon.    Remember, when you place your order, you will receive an email that asks for your choices of size, color, and design.  This email will not come automatically after your purchase, although you will receive confirmation from IndieGoGo.   1) Buy One, Give One     We understand that simply giving a shirt to a child is not enough.  You can be certain they'll be thrilled to receive cool, free clothes, but we know that we need to do more, which is where the other three steps come into play. 2) Send Them Hope     The shirts sent to the children are designed to inspire and let know that they have a future.  We give away the same shirts to children that we sell to children, but we include extras, such as stickers, motivational messages, and our world-shaker storycards.  These are postcards that tell the story of a person that has grown up and changed the world, despite their turbulent, abusive, and often drug-ridden childhood beginnings. 3) Donations of Proceeds     We are connecting with youth organizations that are working with these youth in all 50 states, and will send the donations to one of our partner organizations in your state.  This way, you know that your contributions are making an impact close to home.  Unfortunately, there is no nationwide, overarching organization for children of drug crises, (although, this is our long-term goal).  Therefore, we identify as many organizations as possible that are working with the children, although it is not their main daily operation.      The portions of proceeds donated vary, by organizational partner, so we don't give an example ""10% of proceeds"" quote like most.  We want to give more than just money, but still strive to maximize our donations.  After providing the free shirts, extras, paying for the organizations to distribute the shirts, and the costs of the penpal program, we still try to provide as much as we possibly can.  Like any other business, we have overhead and operational costs, but we absorb as much as these costs as possible in order to donate as much as possible.  The more we mature and gain momentum, the more children we'll be able to reach.If you would like to partner with us, please fill out this form on our website: http://ftrnow.com/partner-with-us/4) Penpalships     The most exciting part of what we're offering, in our opinion.  This is the connection that we all yearn for as humans, and how one can tell that they're making a true difference in one's life.  We can't tell you which side of the message that difference will be made: yours or theirs.  We identify children and work with our partners to find children that would benefit from and enjoy this program.  We also enroll the children in our electronic newsletter via email, so we assist in creating them email addresses and help teach them the technological skills necessary to access it, if needed.      All communication goes through us.  We will not be connecting you directly with the child, due to obvious privacy concerns for both parties.  We will monitor and screen all communications and set strict guidelines for this program.  Communication will be through postal mail, email, or our online messaging system.  We plan to partner with independent third-parties that will assist in regulating this program.  We are taking funds from this campaign and using them to cover the legal costs associated with ensuring this program is strict, legal, follows all HIPAA guidelines, and protects the safety and privacy of everyone involved.  This program will not be active until all legal work is completed.",13.0,0,"1 Campaign

The Lever Gear Toolcard packs 40 tools into a one ounce, credit card-sized multitool. It fits in your wallet, or it can be your wallet. Either way, it’s always with you so you can get things done. Your to-do list won't stand a chance.

 

The Toolcard is built for people who demand quality tools and like to be prepared to handle everyday tasks as they arise. It's the perfect gift for gear lovers, designers, makers, hikers, homeowners, and anyone who likes cool tools.

column1: • Made in America from blade quality 420 Stainless Steel
• TSA compliant and slim enough to take anywhere
• Beautifully finished in silver or black with laser marked graphics
• 40 Tools to handle countless jobs
• Snap-on clip converts wallet card to money clip
In short, it's simply the best multitool you can fit in your wallet. Don't just take our word for it...

column525: >We began our design process with an extensive brainstorm to identify all of the functions we could have in a credit card form factor. We also studied the market and bought every pocket tool we could get our hands on to test the materials and functions.

column546: >The layout of the Toolcard was based on principles of truss and beam design. By using a thicker gauge steel than similar cards and nesting the tools, we created a design that was strong yet lightweight. The Toolcard design may appear simple, but there are several intricate processes that go into the final product including stamping, machining, heat-treating, deburring, bead-blasting, Isonite coating for black, and finally, laser etching. We worked closely with our vendors during the development phase to identify the optimal materials, manufacturing processes and finishes we could use.
column550: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, 'Liberation Sans', FreeSans, sans-serif
column562: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, 'Liberation Sans', FreeSans, sans-serif
column565:
> 

With the general layout and manufacturing processes in mind, we went through several iterations of prototypes to test different sizes and gauges of steel to find the right balance of weight, strength and functionality. We also tested and tweaked every function of the tool along the way. Then we used the prototypes to test different finishes, coatings and marking options to give us a beautiful final product.
column571:
s=1960667047fcb60e0e6c0e3f05e891c7"" src="""" style=""""/>

 

Jan 2015 - The Toolcard was conceived and the design process began.

Fall 2015 - Prototyping and testing. Vendor qualification.

Jan 2016 - Started production tooling. We were determined to get this party started quickly, as sheet metal stamping dies take a few months to design and build. 

March 10 - Kickstarter Launch!

April 12 - Continuing pre-orders on Indiegogo after successfully funding on Kickstarter.

April 21 - First Article parts. Full analysis of the first samples off the tool. If things are good we'll move on to production. We'll add in a buffer for tool modifications if needed.

May 12 - Initial production run complete.

May 24 - Finishing and black Isonite treatment complete. Laser etching begins.

June - First batch of Toolcards ships for Kickstarter campaign. 

August - Indiegogo Toolcard orders ship. We hope you enjoy!

s=42c5cd241580e68ffe5dd123d13b7959"" src="""" style=""""/>

 

In January of 2015, product designer, Mike Scully, launched Lever Gear with his wife, April, to bring the Toolcard to life and develop a brand of premium everyday carry gear. Mike runs the design, engineering and creative direction of the company while April runs the media and marketing. 

Mike spent 15 years in San Francisco helping companies develop products ranging from professional video editing equipment to kayaks. Just prior to designing the Toolcard, Mike led the industrial design and mechanical engineering teams for a startup solar power inversion company to develop an award winning solar micro-inverter system. After developing a product involving high-voltage power electronics rated for 20 years of outdoor use, complex assemblies with hundreds of parts, and countless regulations from governments and safety agencies, Mike is thrilled to be developing a product with just two sheet metal parts. 

April has worked in the field of education for over fifteen years, most recently as Chief Operating Officer at a non-profit that teaches kids about entrepreneurship. As COO she was responsible for overseeing the program division of their national operations, including organizational strategy, curriculum development, production and distribution, marketing and branding, and international partnerships.

Bringing a high caliber product to market wouldn’t be possible without a strong team behind us. We carefully selected design and manufacturing partners who were willing to take ownership of the process, and who shared our passion for producing only the highest quality products. The Lever Gear Toolcard is made in America, with our main production facility just minutes from our Asheville office. This proximity enabled us to work closely with the manufacturing team throughout the design process and optimize the design for manufacturability. It also allows us to keep a tight leash on quality control and adjust to any issues as they arise.
