We will send you a survey within a few weeks of your pledge and before we ship your order to get your color information and any other information we need including the personalisation option below. Logo courtesy of Fort Capital Resources, Inc.The Toolcard makes a great gift. Create a personal touch by adding initials or a special message. It's also great as a company gift to thank valued employees or reward important customers with a product that demonstrates the same commitment to excellence as your company. To have a custom inscription laser marked onto your Toolcard, select the $39 Personalized Toolcard reward level. Add $39 for each additional card you would like to customize. When the campaign ends we will send you a survey with an area to submit your text and select a font. Due to size constraints, we recommend a maximum of 3 lines of text with 20 characters max per line.To have your company logo laser marked on 10 Toolcards, select the $350 logo 10-pack reward level.  After the campaign we will contact you to get your logo in .jpeg, .png, .ai or .eps format. Keep in mind that the maximum dimensions are 24mm wide by 10mm tall. Also, the laser etches in one color so we recommend a choosing a single color logo and removing any small text or details from your logo that may not translate at a small size.We began our design process with an extensive brainstorm to identify all of the functions we could have in a credit card form factor. We also studied the market and bought every pocket tool we could get our hands on to test the materials and functions.The layout of the Toolcard was based on principles of truss and beam design. By using a thicker gauge steel than similar cards and nesting the tools, we created a design that was strong yet lightweight. The Toolcard design may appear simple, but there are several intricate processes that go into the final product including stamping, machining, heat-treating, deburring, bead-blasting, Isonite coating for black, and finally, laser etching. We worked closely with our vendors during the development phase to identify the optimal materials, manufacturing processes and finishes we could use. With the general layout and manufacturing processes in mind, we went through several iterations of prototypes to test different sizes and gauges of steel to find the right balance of weight, strength and functionality. We also tested and tweaked every function of the tool along the way. Then we used the prototypes to test different finishes, coatings and marking options to give us a beautiful final product.  Jan 2015 - The Toolcard was conceived and the design process began.Fall 2015 - Prototyping and testing. Vendor qualification.Jan 2016 - Started production tooling. We were determined to get this party started quickly, as sheet metal stamping dies take a few months to design and build. March 10 - Kickstarter Launch!April 12 - Continuing pre-orders on Indiegogo after successfully funding on Kickstarter.April 21 - First Article parts. Full analysis of the first samples off the tool. If things are good we'll move on to production. We'll add in a buffer for tool modifications if needed.May 12 - Initial production run complete.May 24 - Finishing and black Isonite treatment complete. Laser etching begins.June - First batch of Toolcards ships for Kickstarter campaign. August - Indiegogo Toolcard orders ship. We hope you enjoy!          In January of 2015, product designer, Mike Scully, launched Lever Gear with his wife, April, to bring the Toolcard to life and develop a brand of premium everyday carry gear. Mike runs the design, engineering and creative direction of the company while April runs the media and marketing. Mike spent 15 years in San Francisco helping companies develop products ranging from professional video editing equipment to kayaks. Just prior to designing the Toolcard, Mike led the industrial design and mechanical engineering teams for a startup solar power inversion company to develop an award winning solar micro-inverter system. After developing a product involving high-voltage power electronics rated for 20 years of outdoor use, complex assemblies with hundreds of parts, and countless regulations from governments and safety agencies, Mike is thrilled to be developing a product with just two sheet metal parts. April has worked in the field of education for over fifteen years, most recently as Chief Operating Officer at a non-profit that teaches kids about entrepreneurship. As COO she was responsible for overseeing the program division of their national operations, including organizational strategy, curriculum development, production and distribution, marketing and branding, and international partnerships.Bringing a high caliber product to market wouldn’t be possible without a strong team behind us. We carefully selected design and manufacturing partners who were willing to take ownership of the process, and who shared our passion for producing only the highest quality products. The Lever Gear Toolcard is made in America, with our main production facility just minutes from our Asheville office. This proximity enabled us to work closely with the manufacturing team throughout the design process and optimize the design for manufacturability. It also allows us to keep a tight leash on quality control and adjust to any issues as they arise.",37.0,0,"3 Campaigns

column1: |","Asheville, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/lever-gear-toolcard-40-tools-in-1-slim-card/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Everyone is an Icon to Someone...
Short Summary

My name is Sabrina Diana and I have always wanted to open a women's clothing boutique that was both affordable and trendy.  I am one who loves fashion but is on a budget, and there is nothing wrong with that.  When I was a student at Rutgers University in New Jersey, there were no clothing stores that we could rely on for trendy clothes, and the school had about 24,000 full-time female students.  You can imagine the need.  I want to open a clothing boutique that doesn't make you feel guilty when purchasing your favorite items because a part of the profits will go to an orphanage in Bangladesh.

The western-styled clothes will be manufactured in Bangladesh (the motherland) and the designs will be exclusive.  Each design will only have nine pieces (three in every size) to capture the exclusivity of the design and share some sense of individuality for the woman.  It will make the woman feel good about herself and feel good about making the purchase.
<h3>What Is Needed &amp
<div>
I am in need of $150,000 or more.
<ul>
• 17% will go to IndieGoGo for fees.
• 10% will go to an orphange in Bangladesh.
• 25% will go to the one-year lease of property.
• 15% will go to the salary of three part-time college students to cover six months.
• 20% will go to the first order of products (supply for six months).
• 13% will go to the cost of space architect, labor for the interior design, attorney and CPA fees, grand opening costs, etc.

The perks are exciting! Aside from impacting a third-world country, helping orphans, encouraging Urban Renewal in New Jersey, and empowering women, I am a firm believer of the ""green"" effort. Everything will done with the thought of being ""green"".
<ul>

• For the grand opening, I plan to host a week-long fashion show extravaganza, which will have college students participate in the fashion show. The proceeds will go to a soup-kitchen in New Brunswicks, NJ. By investing $5, your name will be listed on the fashion show brochure as a contributor to the boutique.

• Along with that, investing $10, you will get a thank you on my blog, www.SabrinaDiana.com, which has a ton of views and your name will be featured forever. You also have the option of posting an advertisement of an established business on my blog.
<li>
A $25 investment will get you that, plus a recoginition in the seasonal look-book with will be professionally and artistically done on recycled paper.
<li>

$50 screams a canvas bag! Your investment will include a canvas bag that has the boutique's logo including all the fun perks above. If you bring that bag during your shopping spree, you get an extra discount for being ""green""!!!

• For the grand opening-fashion show extravaganza, you will receive two VIP admissions which includes frontal seating and a gift bag for each. By investing $100, aside from everything else, you will have two VIP tickets to one of the six parties.
<li>

By investing $250, you will be known as a official donor and will be listed on a plaque which will be staged at the orphanage. It's a great honor to have you contribute, thus the world should take notice. Another way to take notice is by wearing a fabulous outfit purchased a 10% off coupon!
<li>
Invest $500, and you will receive two additional VIP tickets and $25 gift card to the store! Nothing feels better than feeling important... like an Icon.
• Lastly, an $1,000 investment will get you an intimate dinner for four on me, the eccentric owner at my favorite restaurant in New Brunwsick! Can't wait to meet you!

DISCLAIMER: If by any chance I do not raise the initial capital, the funds will go into a high-interest savings account (ING) until I can accommodate the difference for the start-up costs.  The 10% donation out of the final funds raised will still be donated to the orphanage in January. Icons Boutique will also start as an online store.
<div>
The Impact
You have the chance to make a great impact in today's society.
<ol>
• You are helping a third-world country (Bangladesh) and its orphans.
• New Brunswick, NJ is one of the cities listed as a part of the Urban Renewal Mission for New Jersey.
• It helps small businesses!  As a local business, you will be able to promote small businesses in a city and for the US economy.
• Create jobs for the surrounding areas.
• Encourage women empowerment by helping a woman entreprenuer and business owner.  Also, by recoginizing the theme of the store, ""Everyone is an Icon to Someone"".
The basis of this boutique is to be more than just a store with trendy clothes. This boutique is a solution to a cause.  It touches upon many philanthropic aspects all by the means of fashion!

To me, this is my lifetime dream.  I have planned this out so strategically that I have analyzed all the risks involved, but aside from that is the importance of accomplishing your dreams.  I believe that this is going to work with no doubt.  Do you?
Other Ways You Can Help
<div>
If you can't contribute, no harm, no foul, but I ask you spread the word about this righteous business cause. It's more than a clothing store, it is a way to change the world.
Also--remember that anything is possible as long as you put your mind to it.  If you ask anyone, that's literally what I do.

Ugie Sandals is a sandal company, that seeks to redefine East African shoe fashion and take it around the world. The sandals have been hand made in East Africa for decades. We are planning to use more comfortable materials that are competitive in the global market.

We are also playing around with the ancient concept and creating various sandal designs that are unique, comfortable and classy. The funds raised will be used to buy better materials and also gain exposure by taking the sandals to different trade shows around the US.

In addition we want to improve the livelihood of children in East Africa and therefore intend to give a free pair to a child in an East African orphanage for each pair sold. To achieve this we are working with various children's foundations in East Africa.
We had intended to upload this video to another popular site Kickstarter but we felt that Indiegogo was suitable for our campaign.

Thank you, Everyone!

<h1 style=""text-align: center
column2:
>THANK YOU

A huge thank you to everyone who's supported Daybreak and helped get our company off the ground. Thanks to you Daybreak sunglasses are going to be produced and will be launching in time for the Australian Summer.


Now that our campaign has ended you can find us at www.thedaybreak.com and contact us at hello@thedaybreak.com 


Our mission of providing a second chance to people in need will always be at the heart of what we do, and we have a lot  more planned for the future to make this happen.
column9:
/>

Daybreak is an Australian eyewear company with heart. We believe in producing quality sunglasses and being a quality company.
column10: >Living in Australia, we know a thing or two about

column1: being outdoors and what makes a great pair of sunglasses.
Unfortunately, we also know too much about paying for overpriced, brand
inflated sunglasses that break or go missing just when you need them most.
Daybreaks are premium quality sunglasses at a price you can afford. They
have a timeless style and are super durable, affordable, and
customizable. Daybreaks are made from the highest quality
materials, and are designed  for those that like living an outdoor
lifestyle and want a great pair of sunglasses they can take with them wherever
they go.
column3:
/>

Giving back is at the heart of our company. We not only believe in producing quality sunglasses but in being a quality company, which is why every pair

column1: of Daybreak’s sold helps to restore sight to someone in need across Asia, Africa, and Central America. Of the 39 million cases
of blindness around the world, 80% can be prevented or cured. That leaves
31 million people living with blindness when they don't need to be. In our

opinion, that’s just not right.

We’ve partnered with the SEVA, an amazing international development organisation that works in developing countries restoring vision and preventing
others from going blind unnecessarily. By working with them we’ll be able to
assist in eliminating avoidable blindness and improving the quality of
life for those living without sight.
column7:
/>

Daybreaks have been engineered from the ground up to provide premium quality

column1: sunglasses at an affordable price.
The Lenses
column5: >Daybreaks come with high performance fully injected Polarized Polycarbonate lenses

column1: that block all harmful UVA, UVB and UVC rays. They feature a best-in-class Japanese polarized lens that
blocks reflected horizontal light before it reaches your eyes. This reduces
glare caused by snow, water, sand and the road, allowing you to maintain natural
and comfortable vision in all conditions.
column4: >Our lenses are made out of Polycarbonate as it’s the lightest

column1: and most impact resistant material in the world, offering superior optical
clarity and durability. It’s the same material they use to make aircraft windscreens,
riot shields, and bulletproof glass, so we know we can rely on it.
We finish our lenses off by adding two scratch resistant
layers to keep the lenses protected and looking sharp.

The Frames

Daybreaks are made out of an innovative lightweight memory
plastic which is extremely flexible and allows the frame to be bent and then
return to its original shape. Not only
are the frames supremely strong, they are also amazingly lightweight, allowing them
to be worn comfortably on your face all day. Just like our lenses, our frames
have been designed to be super durable and provide superior comfort.
We  finish off our
frames with 5-barrel stainless steel hinges, giving the frames added strength
and providing consistent tension when opening and closing the arms.
We’ve worked hard over the last 12 months  to design a pair of sunglasses we’re really
proud of. We’ve tested a variety of materials and samples to ensure our sunglasses
are made using only the best quality and
we’ve created a really great pair of sunglasses that were excited to produce. <b>But
we need your help. Our fundraising target is $9,900 dollars, and if we can
reach this target we can start our first production run and get you your pair
of Daybreak’s just in time for the
Australian Summer.
column3:
/>


F.A.Q.


How do I custom design my Daybreaks? At the end of the campaign we’ll send you a link asking for your customized design. You’ll be able to choose both the front colour and arm colours from 8 different colour options, as well as the lens colour from 5 different lens options. Altogether, there will be over 2500  possible colour combinations from which to create your own personalised sunglasses style.

What size are Daybreaks? 

Daybreaks are a standard size, designed to fit almost all sized heads. Our lightweight memory material means that Daybreaks will fit comfortably on everyone.  Our frame measurements are: Width - 142mm,  Height - 49mm,  Arm - 145mm.

How does Daybreak help restore sight? 

Through our partnership with SEVA, every pair of Daybreaks sold will help restore sight to someone in need by providing them with sight-saving surgery, medical treatment, or prescription glasses.


Any questions or just want to say hi? Feel free to get in touch at
column8: >Photo Credits:  Photographs of SEVA's amazing work captured by the talented

0,"
column3: >Are you still unsure what to get for Mother's Day?! Choose the Mother's Day perk and your mother will receive a card from you and us! You will be giving her the gift of giving. Of course her umbrella won't be there in time but the card sure will!

column1: MAKE A DIFFERENCE.
Jonas Umbrella is more than a fashion product. It is a statement that making a
difference in the global community is a priority!

column3:
/>

1. You. You and your friends buy a limited edition Jonas umbrella.

2. Umbrellas! All 3,000 limited edition umbrellas sell out!

3. Well. You fund a clean water well in Sub-Saharan Africa through our partner Drop in The Bucket.

4. Children. The well is placed at a school bringing clean water to almost 1,000 children. Where kids are able to learn about the importance of sanitation and clean-water.

5. Community. Children bring water to their families
column4:
so you supplied over 6,000 people with clean water!

6. Connected. Stay connected with the people you saved through our website.
column7:
>Our Story

This project started during the summer of 2013 in Jinja Uganda. I was along the Nile River when I saw a small boy carrying a large gas container full of Nile water. The boy was shy, but he soon warmed up after exchanging some funny faces. After a low-five the boy was running off with a T-shirt I gave him and the container of water. But, for the rest of my time in Africa I couldn't get it out of my head that my new friend was about to drink water out of the Nile.

Everyone has moments in their life that change them
column8:
that little boy changed my life. It set me on a path to try and give back. Now I have a wonderful team around me that all strive to change the world and create a high quality product that we can all be proud of. From our Creative Director Nikol and our first designer Nastassia to our interns Avra, Kelsey, and Noelle we have had great people working on making you look good while we all make a huge impact.

We have worked long nights for the past 10 months and are so proud to have an excellent product, a great partnership with Drop in the Bucket, and we are ready to make a difference. All we need is YOU!
column17: >Below we have highlighted some of our favorite perks! Don't forget to check out some of the other early-bird perks and cool add-ons to the right (like a handwritten thank you note from Josh). **International contributors please do not forget to add $15 for 1 umbrella or $30 for more than one umbrella. Thank you in advance**
column25: >Where is the Money Going?
column31:
>

Ultimately all of the money here is going to help build momentum for Jonas and will be helping us build our first well with Drop in the Bucket! In order to do that we need our first production run and we need to start distributing so you can help spread the word about Jonas.

Manufacturing. It is our priority to get you a Jonas umbrella as quickly as possible. We already have our manufacturer ready to go. We just need funds to place the order!

Distribution. The more people that have a Jonas umbrella the more children that have clean water. With your help we will be able to expand our distribution through many different channels and continue to enhance our website.

Growth. We don't want to stop here. It is our goal to place 5 wells in our first two years. If we are successful we will be able to do so much more, like placing hand-washing stations and toilets at schools.

Clean Water. Wells are not inexpensive and some of the areas we are bringing water to are very remote. All of your help culminates in us being able to place more wells at schools. Bringing clean water to those who need it most is our main goal for this campaign!
column42: >
column43: >
column45:
>FAQs

What if I have more questions that aren't in the FAQs?

Email us at info@jonasumbrellas.com and we will do our best to answer all of your questions!

What happens if you have sold more than 3,000 umbrellas?

First we get really excited! Then we will release a new pattern and fund a new well! If that happens while our campaign is still running, then all those who purchased after 3,000 will get the new pattern! We promise it will be equally as awesome.

When will my umbrella ship?

We are working tirelessly to get you the highest quality product as soon as possible. We will be shipping your umbrella to you in August. We still have to put in the purchase order to our manufacturer and get the umbrellas sent to us after a successful Indiegogo campaign, so please be patient with us. We will make sure to get them to you as soon as possible!

Is there a warranty on my umbrella?
column46:
> 

We hope that you love your Jonas umbrella as much as we love it. But we want you to be happy.

If for some reason you are not totally happy with your umbrella, you can return it in unused and new condition within 14 days of the delivery date for a credit, exchange, or refund. We do not credit or refund shipping charges. If you need to return or exchange your Jonas umbrella please email us at info@jonasumbrellas.com.

We know you will cherish your Jonas umbrella like no other umbrella. If it does break within the first 30 days of delivery: email info@jonasumbrellas.com a photo of your broken umbrella and a note describing in 250 words or less why you love it, how it broke, and why you want another one and we’ll replace it. You pay the shipping and handling, we pay for the replacement. We just ask that you be patient.

Don’t forget being nice makes everyone's day much better! We promise we will do our best to make you as happy as can be. Just remember these are limited edition so we won’t be able to get you the same numbered umbrella and in extreme cases we won’t be able to get you the same pattern. Smile, take a deep breath, we aren’t going to leave you out in the rain.

Where are the umbrellas manufactured?

It is our goal to one day produce the umbrellas in the places we are bringing the water. We want to bring Jonas full circle, but we have to take one step at a time.

We went through a rigorous screening process over the past 8 months to make sure that we were manufacturing our umbrellas in the safest and most supportive environments possible. We are partnering with a manufacturer in Ohio who has design facilities here in the US and factories in Zhangzhou, Fujian, China. By going through this third-party we can assure that the factories that Jonas umbrellas are being produced in humane conditions and are certified in every way possible. The factory passed the Ethical Standards Audits administered by UL VS Shanghai Limited Shenzhen Branch.
column54:

Well, we really need this campaign to reach its goal. If it doesn't, then your perks will take longer than expected. So spread the word about our campaign!!

","MOTHER'S DAY PERK (SOLD OUT)Are you still unsure what to get for Mother's Day?! Choose the Mother's Day perk and your mother will receive a card from you and us! You will be giving her the gift of giving. Of course her umbrella won't be there in time but the card sure will!STAY DRY. GIVE WATER.

column1: MAKE A DIFFERENCE.
A
Jonas Umbrella is more than a fashion product. It is a statement that making a
difference in the global community is a priority!-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- How it Works

1. You. You and your friends buy a limited edition Jonas umbrella.2. Umbrellas! All 3,000 limited edition umbrellas sell out!3. Well. You fund a clean water well in Sub-Saharan Africa through our partner Drop in The Bucket.4. Children. The well is placed at a school bringing clean water to almost 1,000 children. Where kids are able to learn about the importance of sanitation and clean-water.5. Community. Children bring water to their families
column2: so you supplied over 6,000 people with clean water!6. Connected. Stay connected with the people you saved through our website.-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- Our StoryThis project started during the summer of 2013 in Jinja Uganda. I was along the Nile River when I saw a small boy carrying a large gas container full of Nile water. The boy was shy, but he soon warmed up after exchanging some funny faces. After a low-five the boy was running off with a T-shirt I gave him and the container of water. But, for the rest of my time in Africa I couldn't get it out of my head that my new friend was about to drink water out of the Nile.Everyone has moments in their life that change them
column3: that little boy changed my life. It set me on a path to try and give back. Now I have a wonderful team around me that all strive to change the world and create a high quality product that we can all be proud of. From our Creative Director Nikol and our first designer Nastassia to our interns Avra, Kelsey, and Noelle we have had great people working on making you look good while we all make a huge impact.We have worked long nights for the past 10 months and are so proud to have an excellent product, a great partnership with Drop in the Bucket, and we are ready to make a difference. All we need is YOU!-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --Featured PerksBelow we have highlighted some of our favorite perks! Don't forget to check out some of the other early-bird perks and cool add-ons to the right (like a handwritten thank you note from Josh). **International contributors please do not forget to add $15 for 1 umbrella or $30 for more than one umbrella. Thank you in advance**-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --Where is the Money Going?Ultimately all of the money here is going to help build momentum for Jonas and will be helping us build our first well with Drop in the Bucket! In order to do that we need our first production run and we need to start distributing so you can help spread the word about Jonas.Manufacturing. It is our priority to get you a Jonas umbrella as quickly as possible. We already have our manufacturer ready to go. We just need funds to place the order!Distribution. The more people that have a Jonas umbrella the more children that have clean water. With your help we will be able to expand our distribution through many different channels and continue to enhance our website.Growth. We don't want to stop here. It is our goal to place 5 wells in our first two years. If we are successful we will be able to do so much more, like placing hand-washing stations and toilets at schools.Clean Water. Wells are not inexpensive and some of the areas we are bringing water to are very remote. All of your help culminates in us being able to place more wells at schools. Bringing clean water to those who need it most is our main goal for this campaign!-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --Gallery-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --FAQsWhat if I have more questions that aren't in the FAQs?Email us at info@jonasumbrellas.com and we will do our best to answer all of your questions!What happens if you have sold more than 3,000 umbrellas?First we get really excited! Then we will release a new pattern and fund a new well! If that happens while our campaign is still running, then all those who purchased after 3,000 will get the new pattern! We promise it will be equally as awesome.When will my umbrella ship?We are working tirelessly to get you the highest quality product as soon as possible. We will be shipping your umbrella to you in August. We still have to put in the purchase order to our manufacturer and get the umbrellas sent to us after a successful Indiegogo campaign, so please be patient with us. We will make sure to get them to you as soon as possible!Is there a warranty on my umbrella? We hope that you love your Jonas umbrella as much as we love it. But we want you to be happy.If for some reason you are not totally happy with your umbrella, you can return it in unused and new condition within 14 days of the delivery date for a credit, exchange, or refund. We do not credit or refund shipping charges. If you need to return or exchange your Jonas umbrella please email us at info@jonasumbrellas.com.We know you will cherish your Jonas umbrella like no other umbrella. If it does break within the first 30 days of delivery: email info@jonasumbrellas.com a photo of your broken umbrella and a note describing in 250 words or less why you love it, how it broke, and why you want another one and we’ll replace it. You pay the shipping and handling, we pay for the replacement. We just ask that you be patient.Don’t forget being nice makes everyone's day much better! We promise we will do our best to make you as happy as can be. Just remember these are limited edition so we won’t be able to get you the same numbered umbrella and in extreme cases we won’t be able to get you the same pattern. Smile, take a deep breath, we aren’t going to leave you out in the rain.Where are the umbrellas manufactured?It is our goal to one day produce the umbrellas in the places we are bringing the water. We are partnering with a manufacturer in Ohio who has design facilities here in the US and factories in Zhangzhou, Fujian, China. The factory passed the Ethical Standards Audits administered by UL VS Shanghai Limited Shenzhen Branch.What are the risks?Well, we really need this campaign to reach its goal. If it doesn't, then your perks will take longer than expected. So spread the word about our campaign!!-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --Connect!                          We would love to hear from you! <center>
You can also find us at www.stylewithbenefits.org by clicking here!
Members of the Bosh Bosh Project, an organization that teaches girls sewing skills and uses their products to fund their school tuition. We want to carry these products in the U.S.!
</center>
We're a movement that believes good is a cycle, and most companies only go half circle.
We want to source goods that are ethically sound, produced with minimal
environmental impact, and that help local economies. In turn, we want to donate
part of the proceeds from these goods to smaller and local organizations trying
to create change. We believe that by taking time to find small organizations
looking to create change, partnering with them to help them achieve their
goal, and creating a community of individuals powered by doing good, we can
change the world. We want you to be able to submit local organizations creating
change, and we want to connect you with the impact your support had on the
organizations later.
Our model
has three parts:
1.)  Find great, ethically produced, items from
small businesses around the world. By supporting small businesses in developing
parts of the world we can boost those economies, create jobs, and help lift
citizens out of poverty.
2.)  Give back with every purchase. We’re not
going to just market our goods with a charity. We’re going to search to find
the real change-makers, wherever they may be, and make sure they have the
funding they need to make the world a better place.
3.)  Create a community. We don’t want to just
sell products
column2: we want to create connections. We want the organizations we

column1: support to be able to tell you their story, and we want you to know the impact
the money we raised had on their organization. We want to hear about the
change-makers you know, and what we can do to help them out.
Every
day, 27 non-profit organizations go out of business while .0083% of
non-profits receive 1/8th of private donations. 100 non-profits get 1/8th of
the pie, while the other 1.2 million split the rest, and the funding per
organization gets minuscule as the list goes down. This is largely
driven by the notoriety given to certain organizations through
partnerships with powerful brands, while small, local, innovative groups
struggle to find the funding to push forward.
We’re
sick of it. Many of these powerful brands use unethical labor practices, cause
extreme environmental harm, and even sell toxic products while hiding under the
their charitable partnerships.
We
don’t think it’s okay to say you want to help poverty while doing nothing to increase
economic activity if you have the resources. Letting someone use their skills
to earn a fair wage is a much more effective way to break the cycle of poverty.
We
don’t think it’s okay to overprice poorly made products in the name of
bettering the world while barely donating to the cause.
We
don’t think it’s okay to sell products with carcinogens while supporting cancer
awareness.
We
do believe that every action can be for good, and that’s the principle we’ve
built our supply chain around.

Ghandi said, ""In a gentle way, you can shake the world.""
We've taken that to heart.
We know what we’re doing, and we know how to do it.
We've set up connections with local artisans and groups in several different cities, and we're ready to move forward with completing our supply chain. We just need funding to get there.

Right now, our goal is to import products from the Bosh Bosh Project, because we feel they embody everything our company wants to achieve. By teaching girls a skill they can use to support themselves, and using the money to keep them in school, they're empowering women to break the cycle of poverty. Importing products from Liberia is complicated and costly though, and we don't have the funding to do this without your help!
<blockquote style=""text-align: center
<h2 style=""text-align: center

For our perks, we don't want to list specific products we're importing, because the exact color/style combinations are uncertain. Many groups, and in particular the Bosh Bosh Project, use the local fabrics and scraps available to come up with their designs so we can't guarantee a particular color available in a particular style until we get the funding to bring them in. However, you can buy a gift card worth 1.25x it's purchase price to use on these products on our official launch! In addition, we have these great perks

column2: >In most perks, you'll receive a hand-written thank you from us. We truly appreciate the support, much more than the internet can convey!

column1: <center style=""text-align: left

We wanted to create something special for our backers, so this design will only be available during our campaign. The first 50 backers will be able to receive it in t-shirt form for only $25, along with everything included in our change-maker package, AND you will receive it in time for the holidays! After the first 50 have been claimed, you will still be able to get the design by specifying it in the dreamer package, but they won't ship out until January.

Every $500 we raise will unlock a new design choice, and we will e-mail you a survey at the end of the campaign to let you choose! Designs that have already been unlocked are available in the gallery. Sizes available are XS-XL.
Creating change is important to us, so even during the campaign $5 from every pledge that purchases a product will go our featured organizations, which you can readabout below.
*International shipping is available, just add $30!
Manufacturing

We want our impact on the world to be positive. All our perk items use low-impact dyes. This means they do not contain heavy metals or toxic substances, nor are they petro-chemically based. The absorption (or fixation) rate for these dyes averages 75%, which means less dye is used to produce our colors and less water is used to rinse them in the process. For fabrics, we use innovative eco-friendly offerings, knitting organic cotton with recycled polyester and rayon to create an incredibly comfortable product.

The ink we print with is free of most environmentally damaging chemicals such as PVC, phthalate, heavy metals, azo compounds, nonylphenol and formaldehyde. We screen print every shirt by hand, which gives them a unique feel, and keeps us from having electrical equipment running constantly.
<h2 style=""text-align: center
We searched for, and found, some amazing organizations, and we think you should hear their stories.
<h3 style=""text-align: center
The U.N. and World Health Organization define access to water and sanitation as a basic human right, yet many - primarily the homeless - go without.

column2: >Lava Mae is nonprofit project working solve the problem of access to showers and toilets for the homeless. We're starting in San Francisco, where there are 16 showers for the 3,100+ men, women and children who make the streets their home.  Our goal is to retrofit retired transportation buses with two private showers, toilets, sinks and changing rooms and provide 80 showers per day. We'll be partnering with local nonprofits who serve the homeless but that do not have these services
column3: this way we expanding their offering while leveraging their expertise working with the homeless.

column1: The money we're raising
column2: > will help ensure Lava Mae's first bus is as sustainable as possible. We're looking to incorporate solar, but panels are too heavy and too expensive. There's a company based in San Jose, CA that's created a Sun Bus Kit that uses thin film photovoltaic panels that can provide electricity to power WiFi, heating, air conditioning etc. while the bus is parked and the engine is turned off.

column1: <center>
<h3 style=""text-align: center
</center>

Kitechild is transforming the quality of care for orphan and vulnerable children through sustainable micro-projects. Once co-founder Jacqueline Herrera was able to see first hand how these children lived and meet them and see that they are wonderful, normal children who love to sing, play, dance just like every other child, she knew that the world needed to know about them and stop seeing orphans as hopeless causes. They are children full of potential and if we do not help them, they will continue the cycles of poverty, abuse, and violence that often led them to live in orphanages in the first place.

Our model is project based, which means we partner with select orphanages and assess the children's living conditions and see where there is a need. Needs include food security, quality of nutrition, access to education, and appropriate caregivers. Examples of projects to address these needs are chicken coops, greenhouses, fish farms, solar panel installation, etc. All projects are sustainable and have a direct impact on each child's quality of life. The projects also help the homes become less dependent on foreign aid, and they are able to devote more time to caring for each child.

The money we're raising will help with four projects they have on deck. One is solar panels in Liberia that will save the home $450 per month they currently spend on generator fuel. The money saved will allow the home to feed the children three times a day as opposed to two. Other projects coming up are a school at an orphanage in India, a chicken farm in India, and clean water access in Kenya. They also need funding to cover administrative costs such as paying our liaisons who monitor each project in the field.
<center>
<center>
</center>
Use the links below to help us get the word out, and to stay connected with us!

What the heck is Pin-Pricks?
column2: >Started in 2008. A small custom pin/button/badge pressing business. A one man operation. Being a touring DIY musician for a decade has taught me that branding is hard and merchandising is often unnecessarily expensive. We are all but lowly artists. We don't have much money to spare. All we have is:

column1: • People who believe in us.
• Blood, sweat and tears.
• Each other.

column2: >So I started this tiny ass mission to provide what little merch I can for a very low price, so that bands, artists and businesses of all levels (especially the dreaded ""entry level"") can have something to give to those that support them. I hand press every single pin myself... with love!
column5:
What You Get

In order to upgrade our hardware so that we may provide more than just the one inch pins we've lovingly been hand-pressing, we need $850. This cost covers the gear to be able to also press 1.5"" pins, and a schwackload of parts so that we may get the ball rolling and press every order that accumulates because of this pre-sale.

We are still offering the regular 1"" pins, just in case the classic size still suits your fancy!

I'll be going crazy and allowing all sorts of variations and amounts of pin, and levels of customization, and amounts of different designs. Check the perks!

The Impact

You're not just helping me - you're helping the thriving microcosm of a community that is Vancouver's underground music scene!

I am not just a business. I am an artist, a performer, a touring musician, an MC, an instrumentalist, a songwriter, a music educator, a promoter, a booker, a producer. I am a very active member of the Vancouver music scene. I know the struggle.

If this campaign succeeds, you'll be making more than just one struggling artist's dreams come true: A giant chunk of the local music scene here in Vancouver utilizes my services, and it's my goal to enable and provide services for every type and every level of artist and business at an affordable rate. In Vancouver, there is only one other business that provides the services that I do, and they're a big business that can't provide the attention to detail that can only come from a fellow artist who knows the struggle of creative development and expansion of craft. I don't charge anything for editing and templating, and I hand deliver every batch I press with my own two hands.

Ask anyone who has ever used my services what they think about me. I have an amazing repertoire and a beautifully loyal clientele. The reviews have been nothing but flawless since day one!

Other Ways You Can Help

If buying some pre-sale pins isn't something that peaks your interest, you can still pass the word on to those you think might be interested! I have pressed pins for all types of people! If you're stuck for ideas, here are some examples of clients I've pressed pins for:

column1: • Bands!
• Painters!
• Tattoo Artists!
• Charities!
• Festivals!
• Businesses!
• A group of funny folks with an inside joke!
• People who just want a bunch of custom pins for their vest/leather/bag!
• Activists!
• Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much for your time. I appreciate you taking the time to check me out. Much love, and I look forward to hardening these callouses so that you may sport something with your, or your project's name on it!

Each other.

So I started this tiny ass mission to provide what little merch I can for a very low price, so that bands, artists and businesses of all levels (especially the dreaded ""entry level"") can have something to give to those that support them. I hand press every single pin myself... with love!What We Need & What You GetIn order to upgrade our hardware so that we may provide more than just the one inch pins we've lovingly been hand-pressing, we need $850. This cost covers the gear to be able to also press 1.5"" pins, and a schwackload of parts so that we may get the ball rolling and press every order that accumulates because of this pre-sale.We are still offering the regular 1"" pins, just in case the classic size still suits your fancy!I'll be going crazy and allowing all sorts of variations and amounts of pin, and levels of customization, and amounts of different designs. Check the perks!The ImpactYou're not just helping me - you're helping the thriving microcosm of a community that is Vancouver's underground music scene!I am not just a business. I am an artist, a performer, a touring musician, an MC, an instrumentalist, a songwriter, a music educator, a promoter, a booker, a producer. I am a very active member of the Vancouver music scene. I know the struggle.If this campaign succeeds, you'll be making more than just one struggling artist's dreams come true: A giant chunk of the local music scene here in Vancouver utilizes my services, and it's my goal to enable and provide services for every type and every level of artist and business at an affordable rate. In Vancouver, there is only one other business that provides the services that I do, and they're a big business that can't provide the attention to detail that can only come from a fellow artist who knows the struggle of creative development and expansion of craft. I don't charge anything for editing and templating, and I hand deliver every batch I press with my own two hands.Ask anyone who has ever used my services what they think about me. I have an amazing repertoire and a beautifully loyal clientele. The reviews have been nothing but flawless since day one!Other Ways You Can HelpIf buying some pre-sale pins isn't something that peaks your interest, you can still pass the word on to those you think might be interested! I have pressed pins for all types of people! If you're stuck for ideas, here are some examples of clients I've pressed pins for:
Bands!
Painters!
Tattoo Artists!
Charities!
Festivals!
Businesses!
A group of funny folks with an inside joke!
People who just want a bunch of custom pins for their vest/leather/bag!
Activists!
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much for your time. I appreciate you taking the time to check me out. Much love, and I look forward to hardening these callouses so that you may sport something with your, or your project's name on it!",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Vancouver, Canada",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pin-pricks-levels-up-their-hardware/pica

0,"

Short Summary

Two years ago, I toured hospitals in my home country of Cameroon (central Africa) and was appalled by the conditions: adults and children, alike, double and triple to a hospital bed, broken sterilization machines, and wooden birthing tables. Coming back home with the intention of donating money to an existing organization, the image of my cousin, who was forced to bus 6 hours one way to a hospital for sub-par cancer treatment in Cameroon, kept reappearing--I could not let others suffer as she had. I had to do something bigger than myself. Making the decision to dive in, Avantika Aggarwal, a Delhi native that had been exposed to discrepancies in healthcare her entire life, and I co-founded the SHARE (Sustainable Healthcare Alliance for Recycled Equipment) enterprise.
column3:
/>

Above: birthing table in a hospital in Cameroon.


The Product

column1:
While the primary mission of SHARE Scrubs is to provide access to healthcare for all and bring awareness to global health issues around the world, we do not skimp on product quality. We realize that the professionals sporting our scrubs deserve the best, and we have every intention to give them the best. SHARE Scrubs are made with a soft cotton/polyester/spandex blend and incorporate convenient pockets with special spaces for pens and such things as gauze and bandaids.

The breast pocket is adorned with a pocket flap (to keep valuables, such as a wedding ring, secured in the pocket) made from traditional fabric sourced from each country that we are aiding, adding a unique and fashionable flare to each scrub top, and allowing each scrub wearer to become an identifiable ambassador for healthcare development, globally.


The Impact

As a wearer of SHARE Scrubs medical apparel, you are acting as an advocate for building sustainable healthcare systems around the world. Because SHARE Scrubs donates 25% of all profits to our nonprofit sister organization, SHARE the impact you are making is great: for every $1, you are providing about $20 worth of life-saving medical supplies such as sterilization machines, x-ray machines, proper surgical tools, hospital beds, and neonatal incubators. 

The project is no easy feat, but together, we can assure that millions of people around the world have access to quality healthcare. 


What We Need 

The money raised from this Indiegogo campaign will allow us to start the production process. Upon receiving funds, we will be able to:

1) Finalize our designs and specifications
2) Order prototypes to be used for pre-orders and marketing materials
3) Go into small-scale full production

Essentially, if fully funded, we will, finally, be able to launch SHARE Scrubs, kickstarting our path towards promoting and delivering better healthcare for all.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps. Spread the word! Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, blogs, or even by word. Our greatest motivator is knowing that people like you believe in us.

My name is Dario Stefanou, the founder of Ibex Climbing Holds and I wish to share with you the story of IBEX.

Some
three years ago I got in a warehouse determined to stay there until I
produced a unique and innovative climbing hold. A few years later and
after numerous attempts followed by (the wrong) surprises, failures and
disappointments, it finally came the time of reward
started getting full of colorful and playful objects, the IBEX climbing

holds! I was still in the warehouse but happy and proud.

Throughout
this process and challenge I was not alone. Many people, each through
their own specialized field, added something to the whole picture, one
by handling the engineering aspect, others by giving advice related to
the production line, others by sculpting prototypes and others by giving
business advice but all with the same genuine enthousiasm. Soon we all

gathered under one roof, with one goal. 

We now had a new big location and IBEX was born. IBEX
is the result of many people putting their talents and devotion into
the creation of the first company that designs and manufactures climbing
holds in Greece. We are determined, devoted perfectionists and we love

what we do.

                                                        WE ARE IBEX

Where are we at :

As we have
mentioned before everything is almost ready for the final production, we have
done extended research, we have created a line of production capable of
producing a sufficient amount of products and enough to satisfy the needs of
demand without having to sacrifice anything as far as quality is concerned. We
are ready, almost ready...
We
just successfully took part in a European Founding Program (NSRF). The thing is
that they don’t fully grand us, only part of the total amount is being granded
(the big part!). The rest of the sum needs to be funded by a loan. This is where
Indiegogo comes in. We need your help in order to collect enough money to
convince the committee that we are doing serious business! If we do, there is
this big wish list that waits to be fulfilled.
(The National Strategic Reference Framework 2007–2013 constitutes the reference
document for the programming of European Union Funds at national level for the
2007–2013 period.)
designed with the safety of the climber in mind. Finished Plywood
mounting board that fits IBEX Training Board. Comes complete with
mounting hardware. All you need to do is to choose the color of your

preference, install and train!

The
original stone on which those climbing holds were based came from an
ancient Greek marble quarry at the foothills of Hymettus Mountain in
Athens. Thousands like this were used to make a large downhill “river”
of stones down which ancient Greek craftsman slid huge chunks of marble,

which were to be used to create statues and other building parts.

All
our Packs are made in order to maximize their performance and use. We
offer them in mixed colors (Red-yellow-blue-orange-green-purple-grey)
categorized in a such way that makes it easy for root settlers to create

roots of similar technical difficulty for each different color.

Group 1
Austria, Belgium, France,
Italy, Germany, Holland, Hungary, Luxembourg, Turkey
Group 2
Czech Republic, Great
Britain Ireland Poland Portugal Spain Slovakia
Denmark Estonia Finland
Lithuania Romania, Bulgaria Sweden
Group 3
Cyprus Bosnia and
Herzegovina
Albania, Croatia,
Montenegro, Serbia, FYROM
Group 4
Greece
Why pay shipping? You are
welcome to come and pick up your package from our facilities, have coffee and a
tour!
Give us a call
(+30-6977231007) or send us an e-mail (climbingholdsibex@gmail.com) if you are
from:
Norway, Latvia, Malta,
Switzerland, Iceland
Net
amount (23 % VAT excluded) concerns companies with European VAT number
or clients outside the European Union. Please send us your VAT number
for verification to our e-mail: climbingholdsibex@gmail.com . Use the
e-mail subject: ""VAT-NUMBER FOR VERIFICATION"" and include your business

information.  

Our products have extremely tight and high technical
standards, a result of many years’ and money consuming research. IBEX has
developed a rich range
of climbing holds in a wide variety of shapes and sizes. Made with dedication,
attention to detail and accuracy, the final product is of high quality in design

and technology.

There are 7 basic fields that we at IBEX take very seriously.  These are the following:

1) DESIGN

A
climbing hold is considered to have a successful design if it fulfills
the rules of anatomy and at the same time it has an aesthetic innovation
that differentiates it from other climbing holds. All prototypes of IBEX
have been designed in an anatomic way in order to avoid causing
injuries to climbers. We offer a big range of holds, including “hollow
backs” and dual texture techniques in an extended variety of colors. The
developed hold shapes cover the needs of any climbing wall: edges,
pinches, pockets, slopers, footholds etc
column2:
in addition, IBEX has created special series, like the ‘’rock series’’ which has been designed based on real rocks.
Additionally, our prototype designs are based on correct anatomy with the safety of the climber in mind.

2) WASHER
The washer’s development has been effected in cooperation with

column1: specialized engineers, aiming to spread the stress efficiently and to limit the stress on isolated spots
increasing the hold’s overall strength, exhibiting 5 times the strength
of concrete. IBEX aims at the long-term satisfaction of its customers.Custom made stainless steel washer for the central bolt, especially made by IBEX,
in order to accommodate both countersunk and Cap Head bolts. In

addition to that, its width allows the design of very small holds.
The
design of the washer socket system ensures that the cap of the bolt
does not stick out so there is no risk of injury for the climber’s
fingers and also that it does not create any indent that could affect

the shape of the hold.
The washer socket system ensures the vertical
position of the bold towards the flat climbing wall that is necessary in
order to avoid concentration of increased pressure power at a single

point.

3) SAFETY

An extract from the preface of the EN 12572-3 text follows.
Introduction
The
working group recognizes that there is a potential danger to ACS users
from being struck by falling pieces of climbing holds that break whilst
in use on an ACS. Some propriety systems within climbing holds have been
developed by manufacturers in response to this problem but the systems
have not been perfected and further development work is required. The
aim is to develop a system that would prevent 'large' pieces of a broken
hold that could cause serious injury to ACS users, from 'breaking-off'

and falling from the ACS.
Designers and manufacturers are requested to work on new systems that would address this problem.
The
regulation described in EN 12572-3 depicts in a concise way the various
norms that have come up in time through observation but also through
laboratory studies so compliance to such regulation should be pursued in

order to improve the products.
After experiments with the use of
plastic and metallic grid, the casting of materials, like glass fibre

etc. it has been proven that the best technique is the utilization of a torsion spring. The design is original, created in accordance with the dimensions that accommodate the IBEX climbing holds.

4) TECHNICAL DESIGN

Another
technical issue that had to be solved was the design of the
construction formula that defines how the hole of the wooden bold is

embedded in the holds.
At IBEX Climbing Holds, we follow a
solution that solves other issues too and that ensures the vertical
setting of the hole and the absolute contact between the bolt and the
hold
column2: the hole’s depth is measured with precision. This way, the

column1: creation of prototypes out of any material (wood, stone, plaster, clay
etc.) is easier, giving us the possibility to design impressive holds,
given that the companies that are active in this field insist on

creating prototypes made of two-part expanded polystyrene.

5) MATERIALS

Mixture of polyester with fillers opaque material\ color, which creates a strong lightweight hold.
The final mixture used in combination with the casting method, which is effected on pulsating tables (for the avoidance of air bubbles retention and therefore of points of reduced durability), is exceptionally durable
in a state of crush
column2: laboratory tests prove durability, which is five

column1: times stronger than that of the foundation cement. These results are
very satisfying, taking into consideration that if one fifth of the
torsion force is applied on the washer, the t-nut will present points of
wear and tear therefore it will break. Namely, the t-nut will break
first and then the plywood will follow and still the hold will not
present any sign of wear. This practically means that it is not required
to have a big volume of material between the washer and the climbing

wall, which allows the company to design small holds that are bolt owns.
Polyester
has some soft spots, mainly due to the fact that it is a particularly
hard material, therefore easy to break with impact, with limited tensile
strength. However, with the final mixture of quartz powder – polyester –
liquid color, we achieve maximum strength of the hold and maximum

endurance of the final product without any alterations due to friction.  

6) TEXTURE

Exterior texture
There
are as many opinions on the types of friction as there are climbers. A
wall climber has a different way to deal with this matter than an
occasional climber. The preferences of beginner and advanced climbers

also differ.
The rules in this case are not specific but they are
sometimes set according to the type of hold (pocket, sloper etc) or its

use (sporting events, training etc).
The company’s aim is that the
customer stays satisfied with the climbing holds in the long run and not
only that he has a good first impression. However, since the first
impression is also important, IBEX Climbing Holds has created
series of dual texture holds that offer low or high friction, according

to the way they are installed.
Through continuous feedback, the
company is now in a position to satisfy the most demanding climber who

will find among the wide range of IBEX products the holds that meet his needs.

7) LOGO.

Last
but not least, there is the logo issue. According to the standard EN
12572-3 each hold longer than 5 cm should bear the logo of the company

that produces it.
In response to this issue, IBEX Climbing
Holds has developed a technology of integration of the logo on its
holds. One of the problems we had to face was to find a way to integrate
the logo without affecting with bad friction the climber’s fingers,
while keeping the logo recognizable and readable. At the same time, the
logo shouldn’t have delicate and fragile parts that could break and give

a bad image to the hold and the company.

THIS NOT JUST ANOTHER CLIMBING HOLD COMPANY.
It is the birth of an idea of a very determined group of people who are
lucking into the future and want to make a difference. We have the
motivation , the hard working built up,  the know how. Give us your vote

to take our dreams a little bit further!Find ibex on skype: dariostefanouibex

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


This project will not be
successful without your help! Please share our story and vision for new
and innovative company. If you can donate, that’s amazing! If not, we

understand. Here are some other ways you may be able to help us:

 Get
the word out and make some noise about  IBEX CLIMBING HOLDS COMPANY.
“Like"" our facebook page (Ibex Climbing Holds-Dario Stefanou ), and let
others know! Indiegogo has some great share tools you can use to do
that.

/>

<h2 style=""text-align: center

Our campaign goal has been reached! Sparx and Mace would like to extend a huge thank you to everyone who contributed, who spread the word and who provided moral support! You guys are all amazing and we really are grateful for all your dedication in helping us out. Here's a small token of appreciation as our way of saying thanks:
BONUS #1: All contributors will receive a FREE color postcard set from Harley Sparx's previous collection based on the Monday's Child poem. See the gallery for a sample postcard.
BONUS #2: As an additional thank you, anyone who's purchased a hoodie will have it upgraded from 50/50 to 80% cotton for FREE!
But wait, there's more! It doesn't have to stop here. With your help we can now begin unlocking stretch goals! With the last remaining time let's see if we can blast through even more rewards!

column2: >Raison d'être for most of Sparx's art, the idea of dropping sketch to fabric has forever been a desire. Sparx and Mace is now asking for your help to make this dream and more come true!

column1: Goth, Manga, Anime, Yaoi, Fetish and Fantasy...  All of these are Sparx's artistic muses.   The images in this first collection were chosen because they share a common theme, that of the creator's original inspirations, and are partly an homage to years of attending Anime North.  What better way to do that, than through fan art?  The first, a romantic tribute to every anime fan's favorite Dhampir Sons of Dracula, Vampire Hunter D and Castlevania's Alucard.  Metalocalypse's Skwisgaar Skwigelf (finally) gets his dragon in the second design.  The third image, yet to be completed in it's entirety, a vision of a gothic couple echoing of beauty, love and fashion to die for!
We want to be able to bring you new designs on not just dresses but on t-shirts and hoodies as well as post cards and prints!

We're hoping to raise enough money to produce post-cards, prints, dresses, t-shirts and hoodies all printed with our custom fan art. We're also looking gauge how much interest there is, hopefully people like this idea as much as we do! Of course you get first dibs and save on shipping by supporting this Gothic Anime Screen-print Collection campaign!

If this campaign doesn't work out, then there will be no dresses, no prints, nothing.. just sad pandas. At least until we raise the money through our regular sales which could take a year or two or more.

With dark, delicious and deadly fashion being the Raison d'être for most of Sparx's art, the idea of dropping sketch to fabric has forever been a desire. Sparx and Mace is now asking for your help to make this dream and more come true!

Goth, Manga, Anime, Yaoi, Fetish and Fantasy...  All of these are Sparx's artistic muses.   The images in this first collection were chosen because they share a common theme, that of the creator's original inspirations, and are partly an homage to years of attending Anime North.  What better way to do that, than through fan art?  The first, a romantic tribute to every anime fan's favorite Dhampir Sons of Dracula, Vampire Hunter D and Castlevania's Alucard.  Metalocalypse's Skwisgaar Skwigelf (finally) gets his dragon in the second design.  The third image, yet to be completed in it's entirety, a vision of a gothic couple echoing of beauty, love and fashion to die for!
We want to be able to bring you new designs on not just dresses but on t-shirts and hoodies as well as post cards and prints!

We'd love to be able to provide a variety of our own designs for sale on our site and at conventions. We're hoping to raise enough money to produce post-cards, prints, dresses, t-shirts and hoodies all printed with our custom fan art. We're also looking gauge how much interest there is, hopefully people like this idea as much as we do! Of course you get first dibs and save on shipping by supporting this Gothic Anime Screen-print Collection campaign!

If this campaign doesn't work out, then there will be no dresses, no prints, nothing.. just sad pandas. At least until we raise the money through our regular sales which could take a year or two or more.

Kairos T-band allows you to wear your favorite wristwatch while enjoying all the benefits a smartwatch can bring. 

Smartwatches and wearable devices (smart bands) are here to stay. It began as a simple notification extension of your smart phone. It evolved into counting your steps, calories, and sleep patterns. We are now seeing more and more app support where you can control music, turn speech to text, GPS navigation, and also remote starting your vehicle. More recently a lot of attention has been given to the health benefits of a wearable device. The ability to constantly measure your heart rate, sweat, stress levels, etc., can help analyze your body in a manner we have never seen before.
But there's just one problem. Watches expresses who you are. Not everyone is a techie and may not want to wear a watch with the same brand that makes refrigerators. The solution? Kairos T-band!
<div>
""Watches are more than just an accessory that tells time. It’s a personal story. It’s your own brand identity.What color, style, and brand you wear tells a story about who you are.""
It holds sentimental value. Memories are infused to it.
It’s an asset – something you hold onto and possibly pass on. This is why Kairos T-band was created. Enjoy all the benefits a smartwatch can provide without sacrificing what you love.
T-band. The revolution begins now.
T-band ND / HD / OD:
There are three models of the T-band.
T-Band ND (No Display):
<div>
(* T-band ND shown with KAIROS MSW 115M model)
<div>
T-BAND ND (No Display) model is designed for people who want
extended battery life, basic notifications (via vibrator and multi-color LED
indicator), and activity (fitness/sleep), health data monitoring without the
need for fancy displays or touch sensor capabilities. This is the ultimate
businessmen’s smart watch, or rather a wearable device (smartband). Battery
life is expected to last more than 7 days with the ND model.
Features:
On board Kairos OS will be able to push notifications such as text messages,
incoming calls, and also push alerts from available apps via a discreet
multi-color LED indicator and/or vibrator motor. On top of having multiple
sensors such as 9-axis gyroscope, accelerometer, compass and optical sensor,
the ND model also gets GSR (Galvanic Skin Sensor) which detects skin
temperature and sweat.
<div>
T-BAND HD (Hidden Display):
T-BAND HD (Hidden Display) model is designed for people who
want all of the smart watch functions while being super discreet. LED panels
are embedded below a thin “membrane” like material which hides the display. When
it’s turned off (default mode), the T-band HD actually looks like the ND model
(rubber band). When there is a push notification or alert, the hidden LED panel
lights up and display the necessary information. Battery life is same as the OD
model (200mAH) which is expected to last 2-3 days on a full charge. The HD
model however has one downside- it can only display English alphanumeric text
and numbers. Non-alphabet characters (such as Chinese, Japanese, Korean Arabic,
Russia, etc.) will not be displayed. Images and videos are also not able to be
displayed through this model.
T-BAND OD (PMOLED DISPLAY):
<div>
T-BAND OD (OLED Display) model is designed for the ultimate
techie who also loves his/her analog wristwatch. The unit is comprised of a
curved PMOLED display (active viewing area 11mmx25m with 170dpi resolution),
touch sensor, and hardened mineral glass with special anti-scratch coating. The
display is adequately bright with equally adequate resolution. Kairos has opted
to go with these specs in order to maximize battery life. The unit is powered
by ARM® Cortex-M4 processor with Dual mode Bluetooth Classic and BLE. This
setup allows the T-band to be compatible with a wide range of smartphone models
(from old to new). The OD model is also equipped with an on board Mic for
Speech to Text capabilities (requires 3rd party app support).
KAIROS MSW 115: MECHANICAL ANALOG WATCH w/ JAPAN MOV'T
<div style=""text-align: center

column3: >*MSW 115M Mechanical Watch with Rubber and Leather Band
>*MSW 115G - Double Plated Rose Gold Mechanical Watch with Rubber and Leather Band

column1: <div style=""text-align: center
column3: >*MSW 115B - DLC Plated All Black Mechanical Watch with Rubber and Leather Band

column1: Award winning design (Red Dot Design Award 2014 – Honorable Mention).
The MSW 115 model design was inspired by inverting the traditional desktop
computer and recreating nostalgic memories of the PC revolution. The face plate
mimics a PCB design, while the second hand has been turned into a fan blade to
mimic the fan on the desktop used to cool down the electronic components. A fan
cover (mesh) is positioned on top of the open heart (wheel balance) area as
well. The watch dimension is 13.5mm high and is 46mm in diameter (excluding
crown). This version will have the popular skeleton lug designs from the
initial concept drawings (actual photos shows non skeleton design as the
prototype of the skeleton design lug ends were not ready at the time of the photo
shoot). Weight is approximately 120g. MSW, as well as SSW models are designed
for true-watch enthusiasts who prefer larger dimensions and solid weight.
However, keep in mind that with different adapters on the T-band you are able
to interchange the watch with other watch brands. (Some watches have very
unique size or lug end designs. Although Kairos will try to make numerous types
of adapters, availability for all lug end sizes and designs is not guaranteed.)
The MSW 115 models are equipped with Miyota Japan Movements
(part of Citizen Group). It uses the highly reputable and reliable 82S7 model
(21 Jewels, 21600 bph, 42 hour power reserve). The watch is 3ATM (30meters)
water resistant.
Materials: Stainless steel 316L, Double Gold plating (for
Gold models only), DLC coated Black (for Black models only), Sapphire Crystal
glass.
KAIROS MSW 158: MECHANICAL ANALOG WATCH w/ SWISS MOV'T

column2: >*MSW 158M Mechanical Watch with Rubber and Leather Band &gt

column1: <div style=""text-align: center
<div style=""text-align: center
*MSW 158G - Double Plated Rose Gold Mechanical Watch with Rubber and Leather Band
<div style=""text-align: center

column2: >*MSW 158B - DLC Plated All Black Mechanical Watch with Rubber and Leather Band

column1: <div>
The SSW 158 model brings together classical design elements
with a sporty edge. Enlarged numbers provide character to the design as well as
demanding attention. The SSW 158 design was designed to attract attention from
1 meter away, but also look exquisite up close. The watch dimension is 13.5mm
high and is 46mm in diameter (excluding crown). This version will have the
popular skeleton lug designs from the initial concept drawings (actual photos
shows non skeleton design as the prototype of the skeleton design lug ends were
not ready at the time of the photo shoot). Weight is approximately 120g. MSW,
as well as SSW models are designed for true-watch enthusiasts who prefer larger
dimensions and solid weight. However, keep in mind that with different adapters
on the T-band you are able to interchange the watch with other watch brands. (Some
watches have very unique size or lug end designs. Although Kairos will try to
make numerous types of adapters, availability for all lug end sizes and designs
is not guaranteed.)
The SSW 158 models are equipped with a highly reputable
Soprod Swiss movement (part of Festina Group). It uses the A10BV-2 movement (25
Jewels, 28800 bph, 42 hour power reserve). The watch is 3ATM (30 meters) water
resistant. SSW 158 models also have an open back design (hardened mineral
glass) that proudly shows the movements. It also has Kairos logo engraved on
the rotor.
Materials: Stainless steel 316L, Double Gold plating (for
Gold models only), DLC coated Black (for Black models only), Sapphire Crystal
glass.
The Perks:

The perk list on the right may seem overwhelming, but in fact it's pretty simple. 
It's broken down to two categories: Early Bird Special, and Regular Pre-Order discount special. Each category has these options:

T-BAND ONLY - option to purchase T-BAND ND, HD, or OD only. 
KAIROS ANALOG WATCH ONLY - option to purchase your choice of MSW or SSW models and the various colors. 
KAIROS ANALOG WATCH WITH your choice of T-BAND COMBO - option to select your choice of watch and T-band.
KAIROS ANALOG WATCH + T-BAND ND COMBO units:
<div style=""text-align: center

column2:
>
MSW115M +T-BAND ND         MSW115G + T-BAND ND        MW115B + T-BAND ND

MSW 115M + T-BAND OD        MSW115G + T-BAND OD         MSW115B + T-BAND OD
SSW158M + T-BAND OD         SSW158G + T-BAND OD        SSW158B + T-BAND OD
<div style=""text-align: center
column2: >More photos are available for viewing from http://www.kairostband.com

column1: KAIROS OS:
<div>
Light. Functional. Robust.
Kairos Team has been hard at work creating a solid platform
(OS) for Kairos products. The platform is based on a time-tested system called
RTOS (which is used by several other smartwatch companies already). Kairos OS
will be compatible with iOS, Android and Microsoft Phones. Instead of focusing
on the ability to play certain games, play video clips, take photos, or making
it compatible with as many apps as possible, Kairos OS has been focused on
reliability, functionality, and compatibility with the most core and essential
apps available. Another benefit this brings is the extra battery power it can
provide – even with a smaller pack. Kairos plans to make SDK/API packages
available for third party developers from Q2 of 2015.
<h2 style=""text-align: center
<div style=""width: 100%
<div style=""text-align: center
Notification
column4: >Text messages, E-mails, Incoming calls … Whatever it is, Kairos T-band will keep you informed.

Send pre-set text messages while driving. Remote start, control, and monitor your vehicle (requires additional modules to be installed in your vehicle). It’s all in your control.

Interchangeable
column3: >Kairos T-band is designed to work with any analog watch. Simply change out the band on your regular analog watch with the T-band to transform it into a smart watch. Various adapters will be available to fit different size and shape lug ends.

T-band will be able to push your data to third party apps such as Google Fit, Apple Healthkit and Microsoft Health.

<hr/>

How it all began: 

It was summer of 2013. Smartwatches were being adopted by early tech adopters from around the world. It was going to be the next big thing in hardware start-ups. Fall comes around and global electronic conglomerates start to enter the race. 

As a serial tech entrepreneur, early adopter, but also a watch enthusiast, Sam, the founder of Kairos Watches simply wanted to make a smartwatch that he would want to wear. A watch that other watch enthusiasts might also welcome. 

After filing the first of patents in October, 2013, Sam started to put together his own A-team from around the world. They weren't ex-Apple, or ex-Google, or ex-Samsung employees, but they all had passion in what Kairos was attempting to do. Like all hardware start-ups, Kairos began life without a fancy office. By early 2014, the team was able to put together 8 key suppliers and manufacturing partners. Each partner company's requirement - share the same passion as the team. We were finally ready. Investors were skeptical. Who would pay $1000 or even $500 for a new start-up operated smart watch? We had no choice but turn to the power of the crowd.

May 15, 2014: Pre-order campaign for Kairos Mechanical Smart Watch Hybrid was launched. Without a working prototype to show, Kairos decided to do a ""soft launch"" of the campaign from their own website - just enough to get the word out and attract support from people who believed in us. 

Milestones:

Within HOURS of the launch, pre-orders started to pour in, passing the $100,000 mark in just 48 hours. It would take only 40 days to reach $1M, and eventually totaled $1.4M. Investors started to ring in. Kairos closed 2 rounds of Series A funding from strategic (manufacturing/corporate) investors and VCs only. With new funding in place, development and production of Kairos components got into full swing. Kairos ran an open-discussion style of developing the products. It opened a blog and shared the progress. It started to openly discuss the good and the bad on Facebook. 192,000 Facebook fans became our friends and supporters. Awards were given. Kairos won the prestige Red Dot Design Award - Honorable Mention for 2014. Patents were granted (July 22nd, 2014). New team members were added. Partnerships were made (Microsoft, Misfit, etc.). Now we are ready. We are prepared.
<div>
Kairos is now launching the T-band with the support and encouragements from our fans, friends, supporters and customers.
Let's make history once again and bring T-band to life!
<div>
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
Crowdfunding is more than just about raising money. It's also about sharing the journey together with our first customers.

Funds - Although Kairos Watches already has funding from the previous hybrid watch pre-order campaign, the team felt that it wasn't right to divert the funds for research and development of the T-band. The T-band shares the same PCB, Firmware, and Analog Watch (MSW/SSW) components as the Hybrid Watch. However, it requires a new type of shell, battery, display (curved PMOLED), touch sensor, clamps, and adapters that is unique to the T-band. YOUR pre-orders and support will go into funding these components.
Development Stage: WORKING POC (Proof of Concept):

Production model may or may not use Samsung Display. Production version of the T-band OD will also have smaller display in order to fit the band better. Production model of the T-band will be 22mm which can be used on various adapters to fit watch lug ends from 18 to 24mm.
